content:
Posted: May 8, 2016
												First impressions after two hours:A goodlooking golf game, with loads of courses to enjoy (some 30+)A Seasons mode, which was the reason I bought THIS golf game, and which I am looking forward to (after more solo rounds for practice)A commentary voice which does an excellent job AND with good timing (in older golf games the commentary would tell you that things were good or wrong when the ball had just left the ground!)Fast and smooth loading of the next holeThe only thing sofar that strikes me as odd is the Follow camera. It only picks up halfway into flight, and sometimes flight is shown from the side (which I don't want). In recent years, most golf games (like Tiger Woods) follow the ball from the moment the club hits it, which gives a lot more visual excitement to a quite cerebral game. So I tried F12 to experiment with available Cam modes, only to find that the game gets confused and stuck, and options show weird POV's. After not being able to find my way back to my golfplayer, I have to go back to the main gamescreen and then choose Resume Game to return to a recognisable view. Not great.I hope the developers will adress this issue...Final words: interesting and good looking golf game!

content:
Posted: August 26, 2014
												A quick history about me and golf games; I've been interested and played golf games since the early LINKS series on DOS/Windows, as well as Tiger Woods, and other iterations throughout the years. I haven't played a game on the PC in years, and purchased this game during the Early Access period.First impressions! Beautiful landscapes, variety of enviroments, endless courses to play (thanks to generation and community games), native controller support, Couch COOP and online modes! The feature set is impressive, and the controls seem natural and well thought out. It's an easy game to get into, but a tough game to master, exactly like golf. :) Playing online with friends is a bit different, as you are set to play simultaneously on the same course by default. You can however, change it to 'Alternate Shot' by a quick visit to the menu. No relog required.Some nice changes I'd like to see! I'd like to see more variety in the player creation (more clothing options, more customizability), as well as customized clubs or bags for an added touch. These would be flavour items only, and provide no additional benefits (as the game is designed). The game could also benefit from a bit of an easier way to join friends games, such as using the Steam Menu 'Join Game'. Summary - A beautifully designed, well executed golf game, with procedural course design and an endless pool of community talent, this may be the best golf game ever released on PC. Score - [ 9.5 / 10 ]TLDR; Love golf games? Buy this now.

Early Access Review
								To be fair it's pretty much the only game in town in terms of PC golf sim since EA's execrable Tiger Woods The Masters debacle, and the good news is it's a thoroughly decent effort, easy to pick up and play, but with skills to master through ongoing play, nice to look at (although as a beta it's all in need of a final polish). content:
Posted: March 27, 2015
												I am a golf instructor and author of "Golf Demystified" on Amazon who has played golf for 28 years.  For this reason, I believe my experience and knowledge counts for this review.  The Golf Club is the most realistic golf games I have ever played.  Yes, I have played every golf game.  I currently have devoted 105 hours playing it.  The sheer number of courses and various terrain really draws the player into the game.  Of course, it is not perfect.  First, you need to play the game with a controller to really enjoy the experience.  Second, the game is challenging like the game of golf.  Third, there is room for improvement and additions.  Overall, it is worth scheduling a tee time to play The Golf Club.

number of helpful: 10 of 16 people (63%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: April 7, 2015
												This game should not have mixed reviews as it has. It is an excellent game as it is today! Do not be fooled by the vague, "one dimension of the game earns it a thumbs down" reviews. Here are some things you need to know before buying it so you do not harp on the game for one single thing. This is a direct x 11 game. If you do not have a compatible graphics card that can play directx 11 games. do not buy this until you do. It says that under recommended hardware  andunder the bare requirements for the game. This game is best played with a controller. It does its best attempt for smart control on a keyboard and mouse but having a controller is should be the standard for you to enjoy the game. This game does not hold your hand.  The game play is a simulation of real golf and this game is a simulator without the licensed pros. They have put so much into the physics of the game that you have to account for the environment as much as the consistency of your fingers playing it. All these people calling it inconsistent are really just having a hard time being consistent operating the controls to the game. It is not the game making the mistakes! This game is unforgiving and if only with the added handicap does it love you. So if you get it, practice, and look at the tutorials on their website explaining golf physics and information in understanding their game. You would realize it was you all along. This is not a simple push a button to hit the ball sort of game. It also does not display the line of trajectory before you hit. This at which I think is amazing. Do you see the line of trajectory of your golf ball before you drive or putt in real life? NO! Can you imagine how boring the leaderboards would be if they held your hand to the top. A popular game called Dark Souls is so popular because of how hard it is. This game is the golf version of that. It is hard and that is why it is fun and also fair. Now with that there are a few things I hope change for the better to make this game even better with some suggeastions. A little more selection in the appearance and attire including colors of the golfers and clothes would be nice. I do not believe female characters tee off at the female tees. Not that they need to, but the ability to do that would be nice. Maybe you could come up with attributes for each person so one players golfer drives further, or pitches better. It seems fake that everyone can carry a ball if they perfectly control it and account for weather, hit 265 yards every time. So maybe have some diversity somehow, which would unfortunately mess with the balance of the game so it is tough idea, but play with it. Just something so that if all things are perfect, we don’t hit the same distance. Right now we have a few avatars who have the same muscle strength.Another feature that would be nice, is if when you are looking for a course to play it would display if you have played it. The game does not immediately display if you have played the course. This game has so many courses and I forget which ones i have played. You have to click on the course and go to leader boards to see what previous score you earned to know if you have played that course. So maybe a quick indicator if you played, maybe even how many times you have played it and maybe even a score display since last time you played it. I know since this is a golf simulator most people would not go play golf when weather is bad and the conditions suck, but maybe you can allow rain and other features. Maybe bring the variable of temperature to the game and how it effects golf ball movement. It wouldn’t be the first time someone coordinated a game of golf with friends and by the time you reach the back nine a storm cloud emerged bringing lightning and thunder or if it is a cold day maybe a little sleet or snow came in with the clouds. Then maybe you can go back to the club and wait (pretty much skip bad weather) on take the challenge of playing in the even worst weather. Now gamers, don’t overreach with this comment that this would mean they have to simulate the golfers health if they get struck by lightning and maybe you should manage hydration and injury or your mood or your golfers social relations because your worried your wife is going to find out your cheating on her ;-) and that will effect your game. I doubt the creators would go so far, but that suggestion of even more varied weather might be a great additional feature. I hope they come up with more game modes to play on, Like foursome, scramble Ambrose, Texas/ Champagne  scramble, skins , greensome, patsome, chapman, better/best ball. The amount of statistics the game provides is phenomenal. Add more if you can.  Like 3 days ago and yesterday stats.The ability to play a course while playing other peoples ghost games is amazing. Also you can play your previous ghost games against yourself. See where you went wrong. Genius!The graphics are phenomenal. This game is beautiful hence direct x 11 requirmentAdd more subtle sound effects. Like a plane going by. Love it when planes go by. A golf course by my house is near a airport and i actually find that sound soothing lol. More ambience sound effects.  Maybe, instead of using the course maker, actually make a driving range or putting, pitching, chipping range. Of course you can do this in the course editor with no tarnishment to your stats, but still. By the way that course editor is ♥♥♥♥ing amazing. The amount of options one can take and the amount of courses the community has made is gorgeous. You will almost never have to play the same course twice and if you do, play to beat your own records or beat someone elses. Maybe allow people to make custom clothes and clubs? Anyway, just an amazing game this is. All my suggestions and feedback should not be a list of disappointments the game does not have, but rather a fan boy going far and beyond. Please do your research before buying this game to see if it is for you. They are not falsely advertising the game, you are just lazy. Do your research please! If i think of any other addons, comments for my review I will add it later. Thanks you guys for the great game and I hope you are not done improving it. You have really made something special in this game

number of helpful: 10 of 16 people (63%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 5, 2014
												“I'm hitting the woods just great, but I'm having a terrible time getting out of them”. ~Harry ToscanoThus an extremely accurate description of my own golf game in real life. Mates good naturedly sledging each other whilst playing a round at the local Golf Course is a strangely relaxing way to enjoy a day. Yep it is a game where “……….. you yell "fore," shoot six, and write down five”. ~Paul HarveyNo longer however, as HB Studio’s has recently released The Golf Club. This is a golf game based on that premise of it is you and your mates playing at your local golf club. There are no licensed courses, and strangely this makes little difference as there are more excellent courses than you will ever be able to play from the 1000’s already available.When playing these courses you will feel like a virtual champion, even by scoring +2 or -8 and for the majority of virtual golfers this will probably be around your score. That is exactly what makes this game so good, yes you will hit drives straighter, but still have your shanks; you will still have some tricky approach shots which at times will make you feel like a hero and other times like you are playing real golf; and the putting in my opinion is the best that has ever been in a golf game. The amount of putts I just miss, genuinely makes me feel like I really am out on the golf course.The graphics are of a very good quality, you will not be disappointed by the look of these courses, though be aware there are a very few, that could make your system of choice chug due to the amount of detail that has been added in. HB Studio’s were on to this quickly though and have now placed a cap on the amount of detail that can be added to prevent this, however there is still plenty of room to create your course rendition.Yes, you have read between the lines well from the odd comments in the last few paragraphs. This golf game also comes with an extremely good course creator. How good, well the Greg Norman design company now use it as a design tool for their clients, and there are many superb user created courses, some of which can be seen here on my YouTube Channel; https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLaQ9yFmYtTDa1Ln3hzklh6jeJMPz-m2uBIn conclusion this is a golf game no virtual golfer should be without in their collection. The course designer is worth the price of admission alone and well the game play itself;  “If I had cleared the trees and drove the green, it would’ve been a great shot ~ Sam Snead", will keep you coming back for round after virtual round.

number of helpful: 10 of 16 people (63%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: May 24, 2014
Early Access Review
								This review was inspired by some of the forum posts i have seen of late. Many are complaining that it's difficult, other's try to compare this to tiger woods. The biggest complaint is the fact that this game is difficult, it has not indication of where the ball will land, you cannot change your power on the swing as effectively as in every other golf game. There is no 3 click swing option either.While these features are negatives for others, i find this brilliant. It's as close to a real golf game as can be. If you are a real golfer, you will know that golf, is part luck and part experience. In real golf you cannot really control the strenght of your swing, your golf club is designed for a set distance and momentum does the rest. You can adjust your stance and swing to give you an INeffective swing which is then called a chip, punch or a pitch. These types of swings are created by constraining the swing of the club. GC does the same. You cannot see where the ball is going to land IRL, you hope it's going to land where you want it to land, this is what GC does. It's not always possible to have a 100% power on swing in real life, this is what CG does.Now if these are going to change, i would not know, but it sure as hell stops the above avarage scores from happening less than often. Along with the course designer, you will always have to think to play and not run in like a pro and finish 24 below par. The game has some performance issues and there are a few hiccups, hence the ALPHA state. There are however a few recommendations that will turn this into the best Golf game i have played to date. Having a stamina meter or the option to play randomly created golf courses of your friends will really make this one shine.For those seeking something easier, run back to your Mario Golf or PGA tiger woods games and stay away from this one. This is golf....in digital form, so SUCK IT UP and welcome to the real golfer's world.

												If you're interested enough to be reading these reviews, you'll like The Golf Club. The graphics are pleasant, but not particularly impressive.  The gameplay is more "sim" than "arcade" style (meaning you can't apply spin to the ball in mid-air). There's no RPG-style player progression or anything like that.  You just play courses and try to improve your handicap. But the game comes with a built-in course designer tool allowing anyone to create  their dream course. And there are *a lot* of very, very, very, *deep breath*, very, very, very good user-created courses out there.Then again, The Golf Club 2 is supposed to come out in 2017, so maybe just wait for that?

												"The Golf Club" is the most enjoyable computer golf game I have ever played. A 360 controller is a must (do not use keyboard controls) - it was hard to give up the 3 key-click shot (of other games) but I think I like the 360 control better. Play alone, play with others, play with ghost players...it is all good. Typical golf games have limited courses to play; this one has more than you could ever play in a lifetime. The course creator is an awesome tool (a little bit trial & error to learn) but it makes me appreciate the time & effort that went into some of the user created courses.My only minor gripe is the 'tournament' & 'tour' feautures need a little more improvement. The game has a tendency to grade courses as 'easy' (not sure how it calculates that) and the leaderboards can have some mighty low scores - unreachable at my skill level, even after 130 hrs of play).Hope the programmers/creators continue working on this golf game ...or a Club 2, they will have my $upport.

content:
Posted: August 5, 2016
												I have not enjoyed a computer golf game so much since I played early DOS versions of Links in the early '90's. Though I played that with a mouse, this game is much more enjoyable for me with a gamepad. I suspect many of the negative reviews about the feel of the game are from people not playing with a gamepad. The negative reviews that talk about the lack of "leveling up" and "improving shots" are really the greatest strength... you get better at this game by playing and practicing, just like real life. It does take practice, and you get better by playing and learning. Sooo much better than the EA golf games' "upgrades", and "level-ups".The only negative views I fully understand concern online play and the handicap system. That is truly broken and exploited. But that does not take away from the fact that this is just a fantastic golf sim, with essentially unlimited course options. I would love the option of real world courses and equipment, but even that does not take away from the fact that         this is a fun and relaxing golf game. The course designer is an awesome addition, and it is just fun to play solo, or with friends you know won't cheat the system. I took a chance the last time it was on sale, and liked it so much I went back and bought the collector's edition upgrade to further support the developer. Well worth the price, and I look forward to the next version.

number of helpful: 21 of 38 people (55%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 19, 2014
Early Access Review
								Even from the start of The Golf Club's early access campaign, the player had access to one of the best golf engines on PC since the Tiger Woods franchise stopped being developed for computers. The swing system demands a controller, and if you read the forums, you will see that people trying to use a mouse and keyboard are quite sore over the current implementation. However, with a controller (in my case, the XBox 360 controller for PC,) the swing system is incredibly intuitive and challenging! You never feel cheated off a bad swing, as the stick-based swing reads your pull back and push forward incredibly accurately, and if you fade or draw your shot, you know it was because you did not shoot a good shot! With an analogue stick controller, the swing system is the best, most challenging, but most rewarding golf simulation on PC right now. Note, as a design choice, the developers have already said that they will never develop a 3-click system or a similiar power meter. They feel that their swing system is incredibly important to keeping the simulation feel of the game, and they think that a power-meter system will cheapen the game. Please make note of this, and do not buy this game, if you are expecting a Hot Shots Golf or Mario Golf type system!Aethestically, the game is a bit lacking. The game does not have any real progression for your character - you can play rounds, tours, or other competitions of varying length and difficulty the moment you boot up the game. The challenge comes from the rounds that other players have finished, and you are competing against ghosts of their low scores. This can make the game feel a bit lonely, but they have slowly been adding more functionality in, such as the ability to play your friends live if you both play the same course, and you can even switch on a turn-based system to make it feel like the two (or three, or four) of you are alternating shots. The multiplayer feels a bit patched together and enough features are missing that it still feels a bit unprofessional, but ever since launch they have been fixing bugs and adding new content. Once full-stat tracking goes live, the game will become much more interesting as you challenge your friends in a variety of skills.The game includes a full course editor, and this is incredibly important, as the game ships with only a few courses developed by the dev team. However, playin custom made courses is an absolute breeze. You can view player-made courses just as easily as the developer made ones, and a 0.0-10.0 rating system allows you to mark your favorite courses, and see which tee's the Golf Club community think are top notch. Already there is a wonderfully recreated version of Augusta National, and I'm sure more PGA-tour courses are going to be developed by the community.This is very important as well, as this indie, small-studio game does not have the PGA tour license. There are no professional golfers at all in the game - it instead makes you feel like you are a club or amateur player getting their turns on a huge variety of courses set in a huge variety of difficulty levels. As you get better you can choose to play near impossible courses where the fairways are narrow strips of land between two lakes, or you can choose to hone your short-approach and pitching skills on a variety of par 3 courses. As more high quality replications of real life golf courses are added to the game, you will begin to see a product that more closely resembles the Tiger Woods games of the past. I read that this indie studio was originally contracted out to make the analog-swing stick system for previous Tiger Woods games, and their pedigree at making an incredibly well rounded golf engine shows. However, you can also see that they have very little experience creating the rest of the product. The UI is very minimal, the announcer volume is best turned to 0 after a round or two, and there is almost no flash or style in the presentation itself.Despite this, there are many other benefits than just the solid swing system. There is no loading time between holes once you load the entire course. Like real life, you can see the other holes around you when you're on the course, and as soon as the ball rolls into the pin, you are onto your next drive. They recently made shot adjustments more challenging - in early versions of the game, it would tell you exactly how many feet you were adding onto or off your shot by changing the angle of your shot higher or lower. Now, it only shows a percentage of your full shot power, making the system more challenging and realistic. In the future, I would love to see some official branding, such as official golf clubs, clothing, and other gear. However, I know it is an indie studio, and at the end of the day, they have made an incredibly well rounded golf SIMULATION that is absolutely terrific at doing what it advertises - letting you experience rounds of golf on a near-endless supply of courses. The developers have been constantly tweaking, refining, patching, and adding new content into the game since its early access launch, and despite a few early stumbles, the game seems to be well on its way to being the best golf simulation on PC. If you liked the Tiger Woods games, or if you think you would enjoy a golf game that challenges you to be perfect nearly every shot, like the game does in real life, this is a must-buy for you! Golf fans, please do not sleep on this purchase simply because it doesn't have the pomp that EA golf games have. As the community adds more high quality content and the developers further refine the game, this has the potential to be a long lasting success!As of July 19th, I rate this game an 8.1/10.0Go buy it; I need more friends to compete with!!!

Early Access Review
								I'm playing the Early Access version of The Golf Club. What can i say? it plays a very good round of Golf!  Graphically there are obvious similarites to a certain game featuring The Tiger... but thats where it stops. ( same team see ) This is more about a relaxing game of golf, than all those tiresome silly special moves etc.   I also really  like the stand in commentator on this early access version!I believe its one of the developers doing the witty commentary. You should go with him but give him a script! in the finished version. The course content is phenomenal, due to everyone creating courses in the creator. Even if the licence was not available  or the actual real life  course is not in the game, theres always one been created by the community thats very similar.  Online multiplayer , ghosts and leaderboards are all there too. This is going to be such a great game.  The early access version is excellent as it is! so i expect good things when its released everywhere soon. The consoles are getting this game as well. And they do say that all created courses are available to play, on whatever version of the game you own!  so if i made a course on the PC, a console owner could play on it too. Exciting stuff indeed!It reminds me of Tiger crossed with Links Golf.My chosen control method is an Xbox 360 pad by the way. Works very well!

number of helpful: 5 of 7 people (71%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 12, 2015
												Jacko Rating 8.5/10  Collectors Edition BundleThe best golf game to hit the PC in a long time.  The Golf Club kicks off where the last of the good golf sims left off - probably Tiger Woods franchise in my eyes.The physics and feel of playing the game is spot on and I found myself loving the gameplay within minutes.  Graphics are some of the best I have seen for golf games, audio is good but the commentary is an absolute treat!  From the witty remarks and subtle hints at conditions the delivery and tone of the commentator is perfect and only wish we could have more of it.Numerous options for games such as Teamball etc and Tournements plus Seasons gives you a career progression if you wish or you can just pick a course that you fancy and swing away.Playing multi player works fine and there are several options to fiddle with if you want to watch each shot that your mates take or just move ahead and get on with the round.The biggest win for this game is definately the amount of courses that are on offer, apart from the dozens of official ones form the developer there are literally thousands of courses that have been made by the community with the Greg Norman Golf Course Designer which is included in the Collectors Edition, some of which are better than the official ones.  Only negatives are the lack of customisable equipment such as choosing or upgrading clubs, balls etc.  You can change the clothes of your golfer but thats about it.Hands down the best golf sim out there for PC at the momnet and I also have Perfect Golf - the best competition for this at the moment but by no means is it even close to the polished product The Golf Club has become.Great game and a great community follwoing makes this a smart purchase at anytime.

number of helpful: 5 of 7 people (71%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: April 23, 2014
Early Access Review
								First impression had my GPU running pretty hard. 670gtx, 75 celcius, 38 fps. It'll get better but it is.... Unity... apparently. I was on the high settings so no real drama this early on.But the golf. Ahhh... The golf.Links 386. This is how far I go back in this genre so I can pretty well say I've been there, done that. Tried them all, even down to the Wii with my kids. Those bulbous heads and stupid haircuts really made me laugh. Really. This is *golf* and you look like an idiot!! Oops... Sorry. I digress.There's something very, very different about this golf sim. You need to actually plan and play your shots PROPERLY. Got that? PROPERLY.There's no little swing indicators and clicky bits. There's no arbitrary line to STOP for "maximum power". This sim does require a finesse of stroke and practise regime like nothing I've ever seen. It's nice. If you're a must.have.line.to.click player this may not be for you. You've been warned.But... but.... this is easy to grasp. Intuitive even.  (although much harder to master if you want that tricky fade around those trees on the 17th).The visuals in this are nice and no doubt the GPU issues will chill a little as optimisations go in.  It is early access at time of writing so I'm not going to scream agghhhhhh with my extra power costs just yet. The commentary is sublime despite an obvious repetiveness if you play badly for prolonged periods. It's sardonic, 19th hole humour if ever. "John" has obviously played many a round with many a weekend hack... and it shows. Some may be put off by it. It's down to how you perceive it.I like this game but I suspect it will wear thin quickly. The scores are just arbitrary numbers and the stroke play, while intuitive is well... quite wrong. This is not 8-ball and yet I push vertical while I look at the green. I'm hoping some changes in the future might address this. Worth waiting until final release if you're squeamish spending. A must for golfers with scorecard phobia out on the real course.I'm sure casual golfers will find it pretty easy too - after a few rounds. It's not rocket science. Not on a computer anyway.8.5/10 - gg

number of helpful: 7 of 11 people (64%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: September 21, 2014
												Overall a good and challenging game, but there are a few glaring issues i feel need to be addressed.First in my mind is courses with trees.  Golf is an ourdoor game, and trees make for great challenges and good looking courses, but the game's AI tends to place them extremely poorly..... Such as in the middle of the fairway, immediately in front of the tee block, and most hilariously on the greens.Next up would be the coding for Fairway/Rough/Deep Rough/OMG WHY.  The colors of the terrain are a good indicator, but the game doesn't exactly follow them.... For instance i landed in the deep rough, bad me... Wait.... It thinks i'm hitting out of water?..... 58-68%, alright, i'll compensate..... swing... and 10 yards.  Finally (and MOST aggrevating), putting.  The putting mechanics seem to scale your put based on distance, and from long range you have two options, 15feet short or 20 feet long.... But as you get closer the opposite happens.  I don't know how many 1 foor puts i've missed, sometimes three in a row.... Simply because the game thinks one foot away you still need almost a half swing.... Which in any other situation on the green will leave you 16 feet past.I've yet to determine what the difficulty on couses really means (i'm assuming tighter swing control since the red band view following shots is more narrow on difficult courses).All in all a promising game, i hope it makes it to production and final distribution.... Though if you're looking to score -13 on every round, this game will be extremely frustrating.  As for the putting mechanics........ Just eagle it from 150yards out and save yourself the headache.

content:
Posted: May 5, 2014
Early Access Review
								Early Access Review (in progress)This was the first game I ever bought from Early Access and it was worth every penny even in it's unfinished state. While polish and adjustments are still being made as it stands now it's already better than almost any other golf game I have played. Couple that with an amazing course editor and we just might have the best golf game ever created.This review is incomplete as the game is still incomplete and I don't want to take anything away from it with negatives that will more than likely get fixed as the development process continues till release. As it stands right now there isn't much in the way of features or modes other than the course creator and being able to play against other players ghosts (I find this feature annoying and usually always turn it off). I would like to see more graphics-type updates and/or options. Some sort of career and more custimization of your character would be nice too. Other than these (minor) gripes I think it's great. It seems like every time I boot up the game there has been an update. These folks are not messing around and seem to really want to deliver the best product possible. I can't wait to see how the final product turns out.

								If you're a golf nut, this is the game for you.It plays more like a round of golf on the weekend with some mates than anything else. The distinct and intended lack of gauges and meters makes the player more dependent on feel and instinct rather than calculated distances and angles. It's really well done. The only drawbacks for me at the moment are mainly confined to the UI. number of helpful: 10 of 17 people (59%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: April 21, 2014
Early Access Review
								For the first release of this game this is amazing. Many have been waiting for a new golf game for PC and the wait is over.GRAPHICSGraphics are good, but the early release lacks advanced graphics settings so the quality is limited at the moment. With a bit of anti aliasing it would look great. Not sure if its just me but the sky and trees often 'flicker' during animations and transitions but small things like that are to be expected during early access and its by no means gamebreaking. Trees are reasonably good - a bit more variety would be good but they look nice.EDIT: Flickering seems to be gone.GAMEPLAYThe gameplay is heaps of fun, but I think it might get boring quickly as it's a little too easy. This release lacks difficulty settings and the current difficulty can be mastered in minutes. I'm not sure about the putting - judging power is very hard as there's almost no indication of the required power, it's just guesswork. But in saying that I feel that the difficult putting helps to make the game a bit more challenging. I have only used a controller which makes short work of hitting the ball. I feel that there needs to be something else in the swing mechanics - timing maybe. It's just a bit too easy to hit a perfect shot nearly every time. The physics is excellent - the ball spins as you would expect and interacts well with different surfaces.COURSE CREATORI have spent 3-4 hours in the course creator and so far it's great. I don't think there is an option to start blank (without generated holes) which would be great. It lags a little every time you make a change to the course which gets annoying - especially when adding trees. The edge of farways can sometimes get a little funky for no reason but it can be fixed with a bit of playing around. Other than that it's great. I've had a lot of fun playing peoples creations and there's heaps of variety in the user-created courses.SUGGESTIONSOne thing really lacking at the moment is customization and I'm sure it's coming in the future. You can currently choose between a few golfers and change the colour of your clothes which is fine for now. Hopefully there will be a store of some kind where I can purchase clubs, balls, clothing, etc. with money I've earned playing tours. Using the Imperial system is killing me - I can't find a setting to change to metric (tell me if there is one) which makes it hard for me to replicate local courses in the creator. I'd like to see an XP system implemented to increase your ability as you level up/gain XP. Overall, The Golf Club is an excellent golf game and it's only going to get better as new updates are released. Thank you for filling hole that was left after Tiger Woods Online shut down.

number of helpful: 10 of 17 people (59%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: October 9, 2014
												     A very refreshing and different spin on the golf vidoe game genre. Bit of a graphics hog but Hb Studios is still hevily invested in the community and keeps tweaking, updating and optimizing this wonderful golf game. If you like the feel of a weekend golfer type game without all the commercialism and unrealistic buffs and boosts then this is your game. Plus it comes with a nice course creator for those that enjoy spending their time making player created content.     The swing mechanic is done very well (sorry no 3 click here) as it was heavily worked on and tested during Aplha, Beta and Early Release. It' probably the best thing I enjoy about the game. It requires some time investment to get used to it but that is what makes it great. You'll find plenty of rewarding moments when you pull of some fantastic putts and shots.     HB Studios has done some interesting and different takes on multiplayer and the social aspect of the game but that is what makes it refreshing and fun. You'll find some negative feedback but kudos to HB Studios for not trying to please everyone and sticking to their fundamental precepts about the game. If you do decide to buy take the time to read through the forums and give them some constructive feedback as to how they may improve the game. While you might not get what you wish for you will at least be heard and considered. I can't thank them enough as I and many others have been waiting for decades for a golfing game like this.Thanks again HB Studios!

content:
Posted: June 25, 2016
												I had been looking for a good PC golf simulation but they seem to have gone the way of the Macarena.  I thought the graphics were more than decent but then again I started with Mean 18 on the Atari ST in 1985. The interface is easy to learn and getting through the first two rounds was enough to get the basic play down. Driving is easy. Putting is not. The game was immersive enough to consume an entire afternoon at first sitting which leaves me to explain why nothing got done when so much needed doing....The only issue that I've had has been that the game occaisionally froze but this may be a function of my GPU driver. I had not read that this was a common issue. The good news was that the game saved  itself and could be continued.The Golf Club was what I was looking for and it exceeded my expectations particularly given the $10 price point which included added content.  There are many features that I have not looked at. There are different courses to play and the game can be played at different skill levels.I found that Total Golf was  a fine way to return to the realm of digital golf.6/26/16  The issue that I had with the game freezing can be solved by presing ALT+Enter at the same time as the game loads. This will take the game out of Windows mode and solve the  driver problem. After playing another couple of rounds, I really don't understand the mixed reviews.

Posted: April 20, 2014
												UPDATE as of 12/30/14I jumped on this game with a friend the other day and I really felt the need to update my review. They have really improved this game. The mechanics are so much better than the last time I played, it is astounding. The multiplayer is still a little weird, but it is playable. $30-$35 is pretty steep still, but if you can snag this game when it's on sale, it would be a good buy.***********************Previous Review Below*******************************UPDATE .51: As of this update, They have added turn based multiplayer which is a step in the right direction and I applaud them for this action. When your friend hits, you are still seeing them a few seconds late but I have hopes that they will improve this. The only thing keeping my reccomendation a no is really the price tag.I think once the ingame issues are ironed out, it will be worth the $30 tag. But as of right now, it is not.***********************Previous Review Below*******************************At this state, I would not buy it unless you are wanting to play this game by yourself.My biggest reason that I am not recommending this game is becuase of the lack of structured multiplayer. I bought this game for that one purpose and I feel let down. The multiplayer it currently has, has you select your friends that are currently playing that course and that will allow you to see them on your scorecard. From there, you go into the game and your friend hits the ball and about 10-20 seconds later, you see their ball fly after they hit. It is very hard to Play a game with friends when you want to see their shots and want them to see yours as well. If you come from WGT, You know what I mean here. Your friend can finish the hole and move on to the next hole before you even tee off. It is not turn based which may be a positive if you don't like waiting but to me, I wanted to see my friends shoot.PROS:     -Looks Great     -Swing style like tiger woods     -AWESOME course creatorCONS:     -Lack of structured multiplayer     -Club/power/distance is off (ie 15% power with 100 ft putter will go 4 ft on flat green)     -Current courses seem very similar to eachotherAgain, this is in its CURRENT state. May or may not change in the future.

content:
Posted: March 29
												The Golf Club is one of the best golf simulations around.  Most of the golf games I have played on the computer involved clicking the left mouse button accomplish the swing of the golf club.  Several clicks were needed and the click had to be accurate.  I found that distracting from the enjoyment since being hand eye coordinated was a skill that was needed in these games.The Golf Club uses a different method.  I am speaking of using the mouse (not a controller) to make the swing of the club.  The utilization is simple and straight forward.  Press and hold down the left mouse button, draw the mouse back and push it forward to make the shot, and then release the mouse button.  What could be simpler.  This simple method allows you to start to enjoy the mental aspect of the game of golf.  What club to use, how to place the shot in the wind, what type of shot out of hazards and situations.  What a joy to actually look at the golfing situations and not have to worry about the accuracy of the click on the swing.The game has great depth in terms of courses to play.  At last count, there are over 125,000 courses to play.  The range from easiest to hardest.  The handicap system is well implemented.The best part of the game is the playing against rivals.  Rounds from other players of the course you select to play is stored on the servers.  You can select to play against the digital version of someone who has played the round before (known as a ghoslt player).  What fun to play against anothers actual round.The most fun is to play on line with your friends in Steam.  Using the Steam chat function with voice overlay, the simulation of actual golf is terrific.  I reccommend this fromat highly.  Have had the most fun with friends online playing golf.There are some bumps in the road.There is no manual.  However, the company website has many video tutorials covering many aspects of playing the game. Some of the set up and settings are not intuitive. There is no practice tee or putting green (However, there is a video on how to set one up.)The Greg Norman Course Design system is well implemented.  You can set up an 18 hole course in just a few minutes and a half a dozen or so mouse clicks.  You will then have a new 18 hole course you can play right then.  The course design program is rich and takes some study to get all the functions available.  This is probably why there are the lareg number or courses that there are and more added every day. The lack of a manual here makes getting started on tweeking the attributes of the new course have a steep learning curve.  WIth time those that really love design will have a field day. Final verdice: If you love the game of golf this is the one for you.

Posted: November 1, 2016
												I'm really enjoying the game so far. I just purchased the Collectors Edition this afternoon and I have already played 6 rounds! TGC is the closest golf game to Links (PC) that I have played without all the swing aids. That takes some getting used to, but you seem to develop a feel for the shots. Based on the club, lie, stance and wind conditions the ball flight is what I expect see. Having played a lot of golf on the PC, Xbox 360 and IRL, TGC is about as good as it gets these days. I'm already looking forward to TGC2 in 2017 Q1. It looks and sounds good. I shut off the commentator and the music from the jump. Event crowds would add to the ambience, but it is fine without them. A driving range, putting green and practice area would be a welcome addtion in TGC2. My system is running Windows 10 Home 64bit and its performance is very average by todays standards.

content:
Posted: November 23, 2014
												When I first bought the game it suffered from major graphical glitches which impeded my ability to play on anything but the lowest settings, but it's seems they've updated it and I haven't had any problems since.As far as the game goes, the courses people make online are amazing and at good graphics settings, the game is absolutely breathtaking.  There are infinite courses to play, making sure that you've always got something to keep ya coming back.  I haven't tried out the course designer extensively but it seems powerful and simple to use, making it possible to make any course you could imagine.It's great fun playing with an Xbox 360 controller and local multiplayer is wonderful, I love having 1-3 friends over, passing the controller around and talking smack to each other.As far as realistic golf simulation, what more can you expect from a computer game? It does a really good job of forcing you to consider elevation, terrain, wind, and other variables that can have a serious impact on your swing.  It's much more difficult than the Tiger Woods series and the golfing feels much more realistic.As far a fun golf sim to play with your friends, this game hits the nail on the head. Buy it, have some friends over, pass around a few beers and the controller and have some fun on the links!

content:
Posted: July 2, 2014
Early Access Review
								Perspective on The Golf Club This is just an opinion from a complete casual to sports games let alone golf. Anyways, In it's current form, The Golf Club manages to still have a remarkable level of charm. It's menus and UI are ultra clean and the hole to hole commentary is my absolute favorite. It feels extremely relaxing while still satisfying. As far as the way other players and AI ghosts are implemented, I thought it was well done. The real time trails keep games moving at a quicker pace, and have enough visual cues to have me interested in the competition's play as much as my own. Those were the stand out positives for me.Everything the game lacks feels like that's because the project is a work in progess. The characters lack any sort of gear customization outside of clothing, gloves, and shoes. I found it difficult on occasion to drive the ball as far as other players and for a novice player, I felt I was lacking neccessary instruction on how I could improve my shot distance and accuracy. I felt that I either hit the ball with too low a shot power percentage or at exactly 100%, even if that's not what I wanted. Maybe if I can't pick up on the visual measurement for shot power a meter could be implemented like in other golf games. The game also did not show a guess as to where the ball could land, but just an idea of where I was aiming. In conjunction with the scout camera, I actually liked the lack of extra graphics on the grass, but at the same time, some of my shots suffered due to a poor understanding of where I had really aimed the ball. The game lacked the female golfer model, facial customization, and the games graphics, while suitable, need a lot of work done in regards to vegetation, trees, and their shadowing. All in all though, I felt that my purchase has already been justified if it helps the developers reach the next patch/update. I am excited in the future of this title, because with the lack of a new Tiger Woods game, a lot is riding on this game to fill a gap for me.

number of helpful: 4 of 6 people (67%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 6, 2016
												Changed this review to positive after fidgeting around with a few things and changing some settings.  TLDR:  The best feel of any golf game ever made.  Not without it's problems, but well worth the money.I used to be a scratch golfer in real life, and my persuit of a great feeling computer golf game has been ongoing since the Links series.  This game has surpassed that, and that's pretty high praise.Pros:1.  Looks decent2.  Ball physics are pretty good3.  Putting and chipping has actual feel, and only feel.  There are no real meters or presets to use.  This is probably the single best thing about the game.Cons:1.  Sluggish.  Feels like it's constanty grinding your computer into the dust, even at lower setting.  Feels poorly optimized.  Still investigating various driver and settings options.  Shadows seem to be some of the biggest problems.2.  Some resolution/display bugs, still tracking some of these down.3.  The menu system.....at first I thought things were just in a menu I couldn't find, turns out that it's just that the feature isn't there lol.  It's very feature light.  No mulligans (easiest way to practice)...I get why they did this, but I think in solo play mode it should be implemented.  Practice in general would be nice.  I know you can go make your own, but a driving range, chipping, and putting would really be a nice addition.4.  My settings issue was actually fixed by a reload so...might have been something that failed to load.  I was intitially having problems with changing density of assets.I'm actually changing this reveiw to a recommended.  The "feel" of actually playing golf in this game, is just hands down the best there has ever been.  Even though it's incredibly feature sparse, the core golf mechanics are as close as you are going to get to real life.  Worth the purchase price on that merit alone.This game is a bit frustrating, but I have high hopes for the future.  If the options /modes can be fleshed out a bit, this will certainly go on to be the best golf game produced.  As it stands now, it plays the best of anything.  Nothing has ever captured the feel of putting and chipping like this game does.  You really do develop a sense of what to do just by looking at the course, and not by looking at numbers, that's a major accomplishment.

number of helpful: 6 of 10 people (60%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: July 11, 2014
												Update 10/5/14:  Verdict - I'm putting up the clubs until things are fixed.I've put a ton of hours into this game (170+ hours), only because the developer (who is active on the forums), promised to improve the game in a number of areas since the games release.  Unfortunately, they haven't.GOOD:Course developer - It's awesome.  The addition of Greg Norman's team made a world of difference.  Cheers to the developer for putting out such a great tool kit.  The possibilities are literally endless, as are the number of courses.  I do wish the developers would allow us to insert interactive spectators/crowds to add to the realism of tournament golf.  If you're interstested in course design, this is as good as it gets at the moment. Graphics - When it's not having framerate issues (again, on the latest and greatest GPU/CPU on the market), it's a treat to look at.  Some of the greens appear to be jagged around the edges on high spots, but overall, they look good.BAD:Framerate - Nothing has been done to address the glitchiness/bugs in this game.  For instance, on many of the games courses (predominantly on Links or Desert courses), the screen simply stutters upon any movement.  On some courses, the ball or hole on the greens just disappear.  Try attempting to make a putt with no ball or hole.  The developer stated they were working on fixing these bugs over a month ago, however, it is quite evident they've done nothing to solve these issues.  That is extremely frustrating when some courses do not have this issue, are beautiful to look at, and run smoothly  Stats - This is supposed to be a simulation game, but the stats keeper makes ZERO sense.  Hey developer, golfers are stat freaks and are always looking to improve.  There's no way to compare yourself to anyone else playing the game when the stats/rating system are completely screwed up.  FYI - The developer stated they would address this in Aug too.  They haven't.  That's telling.....Modes of play - A lot left to be desired.  I'm hoping in the next game (if there is one), will be interesting and keep the gamer engaged.  Maybe try getting the PGA Tour to sponsor a future game.  More game/match modes will people interested in playing your game.Game physics;Putting - It is what it is.  At best, it's inconsistent (at all distances) and there is a huge learning curve.  New players will either tolerate or hate it.  It will frustrate you, there's no getting around that.  It still needs work and fine tuning.Distance control - The best way to gauge distance is to adjust the percentance of the shot and swing 100% (not realistic).  Around the greens, it's terrible.  There's also no skill involved in hitting everything 100%.  From the get go of the game, everyone hits the ball exactly the same distance and your distance never improves with your player's career progress. Glitches - I've already mentioned the framerate problems, but there's other things that need to be addressed.  For instance, let's say you hit your driver or a low punch shot into the sand.  Congrats, your ball will be plugged everytime.....not kidding.  If it rolls in, you've got half a chance.  If your pitch/chip hits the pin (even softly), enjoy watching it rocket across the green behind you.  Great way to ruin a good round.  Lastly, if you hit your ball into the water, 99% of the time, the game makes you rehit for your previous location and does not allow you to drop on the line of the ball into the water.  The player should at least have the option.  When the games does drop for you, sometimes it puts you into the ruff.....Controls - It's much easier to play on a keyboard then controller.  Player model/swing - There's only one.  Why?!Final verdict:  I love golf, whether in real life or on the computer.  However, this game leaves me with the feeling of untapped potential.  I hope, going forward, the developer gets it right and listens to its user base who want it to succeed (I do).  Unfortunately, at this point, the negatives out weigh the positives.  Yes, the game can be beautiful to look at, but the frustrations of the a faulty swing system and complete lack modes can not be overcome by a fantastic course creator.  With that, I'm putting my sticks away until EA Sports releases the next iteration of PGA Tour golf or The Golf Club 2 is released and it's a complete game.

content:
Posted: August 19, 2014
												I like the social and course building aspects of this game... but the controls, whether using a gamepad and especially when using a mouse and keyboard (I've tried both), are incredibly difficult and need a lot of work before this game will be playable.It is fairly easy to make the perfectly straight 100% power shots every time, so the driving game is almost too easy, but when you need a little finesse, like hitting the ball at 60-90% power, forget it. The distance estimates applied to the clubs can't be trusted, especially on shorter shots like lobs and chips, the distances are frequently off by a few dozen yards.Putting is especially broken, because there is only one power spectrum, 0-105 feet, so if you want to make an 5-10 foot putt, in other words apply 5-10% power, getting anywhere close to correct is virtually impossible, you're just as likely to putt it 30 feet or 2 feet.

content:
Posted: October 24, 2014
												This was a hugely anticipated game for an alternative for the other (dying) golf series and a game finally on PC.  While the game initially fills void and you can play some video golf , it becomes increasingly frustrating the more you play it.  The user created courses are the heart of the game and it's fun to play others creations.   This is best part of the game.  Course difficulties and ratings help you find what you're looking for.  I love this part of the game and applaud the effort that a lot of users make on some truly creative courses.  **Update 7/10/16.  The games updates over the past year have addressed my concerns and playability issues.  It's a pretty decent game now.  Both the wind effect and putting reads have been greatly improved.  They've listened to the feedback and made adjustments, which is all you ask they do. I still would like differences in player abilities.  Everyone's 100% is the same.  The game is now all about your approach shot.  Everyone's drives are the same, so your approach is the difference between scoring and not.  Overall it's a fun game to play.  You should.

number of helpful: 2 of 3 people (67%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 28, 2016
												I have been eyeing this title up for a while and it has been on my wish list for a while.  I don't really do golf but its always been one of those games that when I have it I like to casually dip in and play a few holes and come back to it when I want.  So when it came up in the sale I've bitten the bullet - and really glad I did.The game looks fantastic and plays really well.  And it even has bunnies grazing at the sides of the fairway which is a nice little scenic touch that made me chuckle - something to aim at if you feel really maniacal !The graphics look real - gives me the feeling I am out in the world enjoying the fresh air.  My only complaint is the huge gap under the grass at the edges of most of the bunkers - but it isn't bad enough to completely take you out of the experience - just would keep the realism if the grass went down to the sand.  Talking of grass - its not hard to tell what is fairway, what is light rough, what is deep rough and where the jungle begins.  Again like the rest of the graphics it keeps the reality experience.  The ambient sounds are great too - not intrusive but not invisible - just right to keep the atmosphere.  The sounds as you tee off are real enough for me.  The commentator may be a Marmite thing though - he'll either get on your nerves or make you smile with his sarcasm and cynicism - hopefully if I ever acheive the holy grail of golf - the hole in one - he'll find some praise in his pocket - but personally I like it.  Character animation looks right - smooth and nothing that jumps out to me as being wrong or out of place - no jerky moves.  You can fully customise your outfit so you can have a conservative outfit or the stereotypical Mom dressed you in the dark golf outfit.There are a number of comments on the reviews here about the mechanics of hitting the ball.  From someone who hasn't played golf on the PC since Tiger Woods 2000, this game comes as a bit of a shock - but a pleasent shock - as in you have to work it out for youself.  You won't get (well not that I have found yet - nor do I want to !) any strength guide - just a rough aim reticule - its all down to getting your pull right to get the club back - then pushing to get the right swing and power - thats where this game appears to be a little tricky - getting the power where you need it isn't always as clear cut as you may want.  From my experience so far it is simply down to muscle memory - you'll get used to where 100% swing needs to be - so working it out to less is a mix of artform and luck.Not yet played with the course designer - but being a fan of game DiY editors I will give it a go in the future.  It looks powerful enough for what I may want to build.So - to the point... am I glad I brought this game - YES definately.  It looks and sounds great.Would I have paid full price if it wasn't in the sale ?  YES having played it now - but not before.Overall out of 10 : I'll give it a 9.  The missing 1 is simply for the apparent lack of swing power gauging thingy stuff.Hope this review either helps or at least makes you smile.

number of helpful: 2 of 3 people (67%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: July 27, 2016
												I have waited a long time for a natural, non-arcadish golf game. I thought this was the one, and in many ways it is.What I want to know however, is why it seems that no developer is able to put out a golf game where the difficulty simulates true play. -22 on 18 holes?[gyazo.com]Obviously, this is someone who is cheating or doing the impossible of having multiple golfers of the same name all winning, but believe me, I have yet to play in a tourney where there weren't many, or most, people at -18 or better for a round.Either the game is just too easy for some, thus requiring the devs to consider making it more realistic, or in a twist of irony, cheaters are all over the place in the game of golf, which is the one sport of which I know that players admit to their own errors and take their penalties. I know these things about the game for sure: It does not FEEL arcadish in the play. the handicapping system is utterly being abused and needs to be revised. Playing the game is very fun, and it is definitely my favorite golf game to date. It is still not the game which makes it "real" in terms of scoring potential. I will always finish last when people are shooting -18 or better through 18 holes, and the game needs to ensure that can't happen if they want to truly make a great golf simulation. The game is beautiful in a different way, graphically. It uses many textures repeatedly, yet somehow that doesn't seem to matter and the scenary is still lovely. It is far more organic than the Tiger Woods and Rory McIlroy franchises, but nevertheless, suffers the same level of either cheating or ease of beating they both do as well.I would recommend this game highly to anyone who just wants to play some rounds without concern for place in a match. I would highly discourage anyone who isn't a cheater and wants to score well against competition to spend the money; you won't win, and your handicap will never reflect it, for whatever reason.

number of helpful: 3 of 5 people (60%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 18, 2014
Early Access Review
								Let me start this review with a blunt statement; this game is not enjoyable to the ignorant. What I'm trying to say is that you have to have at least a little bit of an interest in the game of golf, and I believe that this game is perfect for the people looking to get into the actual game. As a simulator, The Golf Club is about as good as it gets with the technology and resources that the devs have. All I'm saying by this is that this game is obviously still in Early Access, so you cannot expect it to be a GOTY golf game right out of nowhere. If you do have a friend who is interested in the game of golf, introduce them to this game and see how they like the concept of the game first. Of course, this is still a video game, so it does not quite present the greatest representation of golf in reality. It does, however, have some of the qualities though. You have to judge your shots carefully and watch out for hazards. You have to read the break on the greens and also the speed of them. This game will definitely show some of the qualities of how a bad golf round can all of a sudden turn good and more often than not, a good golf round going bad. I usually spend hours on the course everyday trying to practice and get better and when I leave the course, I just want more and more. So when it's late at night and all you can think of is playing golf, launch this game and play the hell out of it. The course editor will allow you to have hours of fun creating the course of your dreams or even a silly, fun course that isn't fair at all. The online game modes are incredibly fun and will keep competitive golfers competitive at home. Just buy this game if you love or have an interest in golf. You will certainly put a few hours into the game.

number of helpful: 3 of 5 people (60%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 24, 2014
Early Access Review
								After a drought of golf on PC, The Golf Club brings back this casual sport and it really has done PC proud, even int he current ALPHA state it's better than any of the Tiger Woods games, and has a strong feel of the old Links series I loved back in the 486 era of PC, having a course editor is a massive bonus too.Tried the multiplayer mode and it's simply fantastic, you can play a full course at you own pace, none of the waiting for other to complete a hole before moving on to the next, you see realtime shot telemetry of other players and ghost players of your previous attempts at the courses to play along with you and friends too... awesome idea!Highly recommended

number of helpful: 3 of 5 people (60%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: October 3, 2014
												Great to see a viable return to the golf simulation game.  Good number of people putting together some great courses.  I'd like to see that continue.  Game play is very good, pretty open.  Control is not easy, especially with a mouse.  I believe they are trying to give the game more of a feel to a swing that the ol' hit the mouse button once, then again, then again.  So to that it is better.  You've got some pretty good control over shot lineup and stance.  Graphics are good.  I even like the rather candid caddie comments, bit like a simi-pro trainer might be.  Others might think it gets old, but I can't play 12 hours a day, so it's good for me to break it up a bit.  Do think putting on the green a bit loony.  I miss a put past the hole because the green slopes right-to-left.  So when I get on the other side of the hole looking back for the next putt, why is the green now leaning something other than left-to-right?  Oh well.  Still, I'm happy with anything that's not arcade-like.

number of helpful: 3 of 5 people (60%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 23, 2014
												The graphics are out of this world.  Playing with the mouse does take some to get used to.I do however have the following recommendations for the developers:1. Include a driving range where I can just hit a couple of shots selecting different clubs etc.2. Is it not possible to provide different swing selections?  For instance, the three click swing (one click to start, second click on power, and third click on slice / draw), or even just the option to swing "left to right" rather than up and down.   Even just a place where I could adjust the sensitivity of my draw / slice will already make the game easier to play for beginners.3. Provide a bit of instructions, it took me a number of attempts to figure out just how to hit a shot.I really enjoy the game thusfar, but it is a bit of work playing with a mouse, however, it is a lot more realistic than any other golf game I've seen in ages.  Hope the developers could just work on some of the rough edges.

number of helpful: 3 of 5 people (60%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 31, 2014
												So much fun.The gameplay mechanics are easy to learn but somewhat hard to master, so the golfing process is pretty fun. But that's not what makes this game so fantastic.What makes this game so special is the course designer. It lets you be as broad or granular as you can imagine. You can simply dictate the type of course and number of holes you desire and the game will generate a completely random, never-before-seen course for you. Or you can hand-craft every single hole, sandtrap, ravine, green, tee box and fairway for each and every hole. And everything in between. The creative tools are a little clumsy, but powerful once you start to learn them.The Dev team does a great job of listening to the community and they'll be building out the game substantially as time goes on.As a lover of the game, I simply cannot reccomend The Golf Club enough! It's the best golfing game yet for PC.

content:
Posted: January 3
												I reluctantly clicked the "not recommended" box as i couldn't bring myself to tick "recommended". This isn't a bad game, but for a golf sim that takes the simulation aspect quite serious it lets itself down in some major areas. To name a couple, the ball interaction with the group seems to be the same no matter what it hits. Fairways are always slow. Another annoying aspect is when the greens are set to the hard difficultly they become unrealisticly quick (but only when hitting approach shots). When you then go to putt the speed is slower.All that being said, if this game is on sale - id recommend buying it for a bit of fun.Probably a 6/10 game in its current state.

content:
Posted: September 7, 2014
												Listen to the reviews if buying for PC (even if you have a controller). This game is NOT optimized for PC in any way shape or form. It's almost a direct port from the Xbox version albiet for some UI changes. If you're interested in this as purely a golf course building simulator it's pretty frustrating as well. You have to start off with their pre-generated courses given from your parameters but does not let you build a course from scratch like you would in say Sid Meier's Sim Golf. You can delete some holes and re-create but having to do so is frustrating and you can only delete about 5 or 6 holes before it requires you to create some more before deleting again.

number of helpful: 4 of 7 people (57%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 23, 2014
												Having played the game in early access and full release it's quite impressive although to play on full resolution you need a super powerful graphics card. I am currently playing the game windowed and on 1024 x 768 to acheive a decent frame rate with my measly geforce GT610 card. The course creator works really well and puts me in mind of the great Jack Nicklaus course designer of yesteryear. You can build a super detailed masterpiece or a quick knockaround course with relative ease and play at anytime to make sure it's what you want. The golf mechanics of the game itself are quite realistic but would still like to see some kind of gauge for the swing if only one that could be turned on and off at any time. Also many people still favour the old tri click method so if that was implemented it would give the game true flexibility. One annoying bug i have noticed is that when you start a game with either ghost balls or more added golfers if you then exit the round after a couple of holes it saves your progress automatically but when you return your single golfer self is now the only one playing. Anyway theres no other golf game that can really come close to this one at the moment it has flexibilty, great multiplayer features and a jaw dropping course creator. Keep up the good work guys and keep on updating the game regulary.

number of helpful: 4 of 7 people (57%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: June 20, 2014
Early Access Review
								I did not like this game that much due to the following.1). The game is like a consol game but can be played with pc keyboard and mouse. Unfortunatly such games always feel like a consol game no matter what.2). The developers write on the forum that they will NEVER implement any kind of power meter that will allow you to view how hard you hit the ball.. Since computer golf is not like in real life where you can feel and easy adjust the power then the game is rather difficult to play since it is difficult to know if you example use 100% power or just 85%...  In the current state of the game it is like guessing and hoping for the best.The positive..:Well I like the possibility to design your own golfcourse and share it with other golfers just like in "sim golf" from the 90's.You can also play with your friends or play online turnaments and gain some kind of score in the future.But they have no plans of making any real "career mode" like in Tiger woods golf where you start with handicap 54 and need to play to become a pro... However they maybe will implement a kind of money system so people can win some prize money in a turnament ( like a kind of highscore i think ).The graphic is pretty okay but i would say 2010 graphic level, but it is not really a problem, and alos the game is not finished in development.The greens are equal to tiger woods where you have a kind of net that show you the terrain and indications about how it will effect the ball like in all other golf games.In general the game do have potential and are not that bad, but I did not want to own a game that do not have number 1 and 2 since that is features I belive every golf game need to pocess especially the power meter. Should you buy this game.. well maybe I would say but it is not worth more than 25 euro even when I imagine the finished product..I have personaly asked for a refund after 33min of playing time.

number of helpful: 5 of 9 people (56%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 6, 2016
												I was looking forward to play this game. Until I actually started it. The game ran about 40-50 fps and it suddenly wasn't fullscreen but a big window stretching across both my monitors (with half the window on both). Typical Unity-behaviour, but it isn't impossible to fix. When I went back to fullscreen with alt-enter, my fps dropped to 5. Totally unplayable, so I restarted it. Got 40-50 fps again. Every time I was about to hit, the game stutters and makes it impossible to hit accurate, so I turned down everything to a minimum, but still with 1920x1080. Fps up to almost 60, but the stutter didn't disappear. Trees started to look like something from early Amiga days, and looked horrible. Water is dull and ugly. Animation was still nice to look at..As far as I could tell, there is no way to actually know exactly how hard you hit. You just have to find out by yourself. Bad representation of the green compared to Tiger Woods 2014 on Xbox 360. Actually everything was sub-par compared to TW2014.Annoyed me so much I just had to quit after just 35 minutes or so.Graphics 6/10 (nice animations)Sound 7/10 (commentator made me want to sleep)Gameplay 4/10 (annoying stutter)This is my honest opinion about this game. content:
Posted: September 2, 2014
												This is perhaps the most infuriatingly poorly-controlling golf game I think I've ever played. Control over your swing varies massively from one stroke to the next and there's absolutely zero sense of the power you're putting behind any given shot. Putting is obnoxiously difficult for both of those reasons. Although one can certainly (probably) get used to playing it, getting to that point is not at all an enjoyable road. Some would say that this just means it's a more serious golf simulation and perhaps that's true for some people, but this isn't at all accessible for people looking for a less excrutiating experience.

number of helpful: 14 of 27 people (52%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: October 26, 2015
												I was looking forward to this game very much. It has been on my wishlist for quite a while so I was very excited to finally buy it today. After 5 holes I gave up and am asking for a refund after only 30 minutes of gameplay. I can't say it's a bad game but I think it would probably be better with a controller (which I don't use). I'm used to the Tiger Woods PGA Tour series of golf games and when I got to the buggy mess that was TWPGAT 08 I had had enough. I bought this thinking it would be a great replacement but was sorely dissapointed. Everything seems to move really slow, the swing, the ball and the cameras. It was like trying to play in molasses in winter. As well the courses were not as realistically made either. The fairways were too skinny and the texture for them was not that realistic. TWPGAT 08 looked more realistic to me than this. I would have to say my biggest gripe is the swing mechanism. It just doesn't feel right. There was no backward and forward swing, just backward. It didn't feel natural not following your swing through to the ball, but I think that is the console port mechanics again. Like I said this is probably a different game if you are used to a controller, but I'm not so it was a real missed hit with me.

number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 30, 2014
Early Access Review
								I was worried that The Golf Club would be a purchase to regret, but fortunately that hasn't turned out to be the case. The course creator is excellent, although it doesn't allow you to create a custom course from scratch. The game will first generate a course based on your chosen parameters, and you can then edit it to your heart's content. The controls don't take too long to get used to, although I'd strongly advise playing with a gamepad. There is no power bar - shot strength is determed by your swing motion. The graphics are pretty good, as is the background music. Currently the player customisation is very limited, and doesn't include golf clubs. It's still an early access title though, so hopefully more features will be forthcoming.

content:

Early Access Review
								(Version 0.9 Early Access)Fantastic so far!  My only quip with gameplay is that I would like to turn off the grid on the green.I would like to see a bit more control of the course-creation process, though.  Once I have set up my course I would like the ability to edit the dividing lines between the fairway and the rough, bunker and grass, etc.  I would love to be able to shape the fairways, greens, bunkers, lakes, etc.  It's nice being able to create a course in seconds; however, some of us would like the ultimate control over every little detail afterwards.There aslo seems to be a very slight issue with screen tearing.  A v-sync option would be useful in the graphics settings.Overall, the game is everything a modern golfer could want in a golf game; you can create BEAUTIFUL courses and play them in their complete beauty with fantastic controls for your swing.  After all, aren't the most important things about real golf the swing and beauty of the course?  (Hint: yes.)

content:
Posted: August 29, 2014
												I've been pretty addicted to this game since purchase. Look into picking up this game if you enjoy trying out player created courses and playing golf with a minimalist UI. The swing mechanics are enjoyable and I like how the the shot modification tries to emulate the decisions you would make in real life. There are some performance issues for sure, but the game is totally playable. I can max out nearly every game I own but I have to run The Golf Club on 'Low' settings in order for it to function properly. It's a known issue and is being worked on. My biggest wish would be a way to find other people to play with in game. The Ghost functions are cool, but it'd be nice if I could meet other players randomly in game.TL,DR - Fun gameplay, fantastic course creator, endless amount of courses, optimization issues requiring game to be played on 'Low' settings. Worth it for a fan of the sport.
