number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 15, 2014
Early Access Review
TLDR: If you enjoy all of golfs challenging aspects, this game will totally be worth it to you.As it says in the big blue box below, the game is an Early Access Game.  However, if you have a half decent computer, I highly recommend getting this game while it is still discounted for Early Access.There are a few things to consider:The Negatives  Graphics settings are limited to your resolution and three quality settings: high, medium, and low.  With graphics on low or medium, you only get a 5 yd x 5 yd putting grid when you get a 15 yd x 15 yd putting grid on high quality settings.  The game is extremely GPU dependent.  My AMD FX-6350 is around 35% to 60% in the six cores while my GPU is almost always pinned on 99% or 100% at high graphics settings.  UI feels clunky with mouse and keyboard but it is fine with a controller.  The user created courses tend to get polluted with courses that really aren't that well made or aren't anywhere close to realistic.  However, if you look in the right places (the forums or other player created sites), you can find some very extraordinary courses.The Positives  Overall, the game is very realistic.  Of course there are a few bugs here and there due to the early access that cause some pretty strange "physics," but that rarely ever happens.  Some examples:  Ball below your feet = push right; vice versa for ball above your feet.  The wind speeds seem very realistic when pushing the ball around along with the elevation changes.  Putting takes some getting used to but it is solely based on the player controller "marker" that you move around to adjust your line and power.  Putting is basically the most polished aspect of the game IMO.  The more difficult a shot is, the skinnier the "perfect swing" area will get.  Playing a draw, fade, high, or low shot all affect the margin of error when the player is swinging.  The lie you have for your shot is a range of percentages.  Plugging into a bunker gives you ~40% to 60% of that clubs power for the shot out of the bunker and that percentage changes for each club.  Obviously a fairway wood is difficult to hit out of a fairway bunker.  The course creator is very easy to use with a controller and has improved significantly since it first came out.Any specific questions, you are more than welcome to PM me or add me as a friend for some competition. :D

Aside from an abundance of overly difficult courses to play and the blatant cheating by other online players, the game offers a very realistic playing experience where often times you'll hear yourself saying, "thats exactly how this would play if I was out there myself." The devolopers have promised throughout beta that they would continue to improve upon the game and actively work with players to create the best golf simulation they can. I know for myself, I keep being drawn back from other games to play this one day after day.

number of helpful: 3 of 6 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: May 15, 2014
Early Access Review
								Hey Guys,i wanna give a short review on my first impressions...First of all to all who loved Tiger Woods PGA Tour and were sad like me because EA did not release the titles on PC for a long time: Go and get "The Golf Club". U wont be dissapointed IF u can live with an early access version for now...Okay, lets get started with the graphics:The graphics are nice but u need a rig which is potent. I didnt have had any big framedrops so far. Sometimes there were tiny  laggs because of 30 frames in a couple situations but a little tweak here and there and there will be no problems at all. I would say my rig is decent: 8GB, 7870 pcs+, i5 3570, bla bla bla ;)The shaders were good, the lightning is good as well but can be a bit better. The detail modell is also good. Still looks better than any TW on console at least it will be if u dont agree...The Sound:Okay, this one is tough. I like it so far but the commentator is a mess :D...Plz, get a second one with more emotions.So far I turned him off. It would be great if there were some spectators around the course to create an atmosphere like u are at a masters ;). I hope something like this will be available for online tournaments, maybe as an option because of the overall performance... Driver, Wood, Iron, PW, SW, hitting a tree, hitting the water, the ball hitting the ground, it all sounds right. Could be more crisp sometimes but maybe that are only my ears which are used to the special sound overload with my last PGA Tour Title.The Gameplay:Although this game is in early access i have to say it plays very nice. There is hardly no difference between PGA Tour and The Golf Club (Swing-mechanic). If u played with a controller and the right stick swing mechanic ur in good shape.In my oppinion TGC is little bit more precise and therefore harder. For veterans its still possible to play huge rounds on an easy course when they play for the first time. The difficulties are the created courses and there are sick ones out there :D. Love it!Maybe the putting need some work. The way it is right now is good but if u have a long put u dont see the hole just the marker. The difficulty of putting, which is like PGA Tour, is that u dont have a percentage for ur swing. Because this game is more precise its difficult to get the right power for the putt. 21Ft put with a horrible break is a very tough one. Maybe its good like it is and i have to get the right feeling. An option for a scala in percent for ur swing still would be nice.The one thing everybody is really complaining about is the swing. It doesnt look as smooth as PGA TW. For me its not a big deal but if u can create ur own player different swing versions would be nice. Right now the swing looks a bit stiff at the end but i think this will be better soon. This is it. Just my two cents for now. I didnt test the editor but everybody says its the♥♥♥♥♥♥ so i guess its good :DAs is said, its early access and there is much to do for the devs but its very much playable/ enjoyable.This game needs no licenses for players, courses, etc...The community will build TPC Sawgrass..Put the work effort into the gameplay dear developers. Make the swing better, give some more options for the hud or the gameplay itself. Give me more freedom of creating my own player,not just changing the colour of everything. Let me plz decide if i wanna have more power, better iron shots, better putting or more accuracy from the rough, whatever...Make every created player unique in a way. Maybe its planned? I dont know but i like to know...Question: Is it possible to play with friends? I mean do i play against a ghost-ball or is there something like a spectator-mode? A specator mode would be awesome. I dont wanna play against ghostfriends all the time if thats the case...I wanna see him swing, follow his ball into the water or near the pin...Predict if its good or feel his pain. In this times where lets plays are all over the place and everybody is watching them, a spec-mode is necessary ;)

content:
Posted: July 6, 2014
Early Access Review
								A definite thumbs up from me. My first early access game and I am duly impressed. Reminds me of Links 2003 for some reason only much better. After not being able to get Links running anymore I started playing the EA TW PGA Tour games until they came to a halt. I'm still♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥at EA for dropping golf and hockey from the PC. I have been looking for a great PC golf game for quite a while now and I think I've found it. Having read a lot of the reviews, I see that a few people want the old 3 click swing and the developers have said that they conciously decided not to put power bars, etc in the game, and I think that was an excellent decision. Must admit that I was a tad skeptical about using a gamepad. My performance on my first few holes was laughable at best, but I quickly improved as I got used to using my Xbox for Windows gamepad. I soon realized that this swing method is about as close as you can get to the complexity of a real golf swing, and it adds a bit of realism to the game for me. I have found driving to be the easiest, and although my short game and putting are improving, they still need some practise. So, I haven't even tried the KB/mouse method and I don't care about the 3 click swing - I'm good with the gamepad. Graphics are very good indeed, especially for an early build, as it currently is. The game runs smoothly on my system with nary an issue, although, I have recently upgraded my system substantially, so that could have something to do with it, from what I have read in the reviews. I have been recommending the game to friends and I most certainly recommend the game to those reading this. If you are into computer golf at all,  I can almost guarantee that you will enjoy this game, and this is still an early build. So, a sincere thanks to the developers for delivering a 'top of the line' body of work, which has been a long time coming to the PC, and to Steam for making it available to us. And whilst I'm farting flowers over here, hats off to Steam - I have become a fan - it's a great way to game!

number of helpful: 9 of 19 people (47%) found this review helpful4 people found this review funny
content:
Posted: June 22, 2016
												I wasted 40 bucks on getting suckered into getting the tournament DLC. Don't fall for the same trick. Take that 40 bucks, and go out on a cheap blind date. It probably won't turn out worse than this game. Another option to have more fun would be to buy 40 bucks worth of golf balls, and run them over with a lawn mower.I really do hate taking my time to write negative reviews, but in this case, the other negative reviews are correct. I dislike golf in real life, but I have enjoyed video gaming ones in the past. I would rather watch golf on television instead of suffering through the mindless boredom and technical issues presented on this way over priced incarnation.I was hoping for maybe a playable golf games like the old and good Links games of the past. Whoopsie...First, the controls stink. For some odd reason, its easier to putt with a gamepad than it is with a mouse. on the reverse, driving and fairway hitting is easier with the mouse than with the gamepad. Driving is still inaccurate with the mouse, even if you use a straight edge to find out what you are doing wrong.There is now way to tell what you are doing wrong, either. You won't find any descriptions on how things work in the game. There are no visual cues to tell you either, besides a diagram on the right. No matter what I try, i always hook to the right unless I screw up, then the ball goes left.I am guessing this has to do with the graphics system because its bad. The games doesn't look very good, and trying to turn up the graphics in hopes to see something nice turns the game into a slide show. Don't let the screenshots fool you. They must be taken at perfect times, or simply photo-shopped.What I find completely inexcusable is that if you have an invidia card, chances are you have to download the beta patch to run the game in 32 bit mode. I can probably guess this is part of the reason the game runs like garbage.There are no AI golfers to play against or any sense of what made these games fun in the first place. There is no progression or interesting gaming type stuff. There are very few golfers to pick from, and they all look poor and boring. There is no way to overswing on driving for that risky crush of a hit. Ya, you can't do that in real life, but it made drving fun in other games. The only response you will get from the developer on this subject is the claim about about being a sim. This game is a failing of both aspects of being a game, and a simulation.The commentary makes me feel like calling an emergency hotline, as though I am about to lose my mind, and am in need of serious help. I suppose there might be some option to turn it off, but I do not intend to waste any more time playing anyways.I better stop before I decide to beat myself over the head with a 9 iron. P.S.I hope the developer chokes on my 40 bucks.

number of helpful: 8 of 17 people (47%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: August 20, 2014
												You would have more fun teeing up a turd, hitting it at full force with a driver and watching it explode. I know you want a golf game, but trust me this isn't it.This game runs embarrasingly inefficient. System specs:i7-4770K, OC'd 4.1 ghzGeforce GTX 770 (MSI TF n770)16 GB DDR3 ram3TB HDDZ87-g45 moboI can't get better than 31fps. When the game was in beta, I could get 60 in windowed mode, and 30 fullscreen. I don't know what the ♥♥♥♥ is going on, but it sure as hell isn't optimized. And even if it were, the graphics look kinda clunky, second-rate. The reflections off the water are at times glaringly terrible. These were issues that were easy to overlook during Early Access. You know, things you expect to be fixed before launch. Oh how wrong we all were.This will be the last title I support in Early Access. The controls are really bad. You have no way to judge exactly how much swing you're applying, other than 100%. The power applied during the swing IS NOT PROPROTIONATE TO THE BACKSWING. Meaning, if you take a full backswing, and apply slow pressure upward, you could swing 10%, 45%, or hell maybe 88%. It's all a crapshoot. Instead of using a visual meter, you're supposed to learn to "Feel" the swing and the club. Sorry HB, that's not the way that games work. I'm not actually holding a club. I don't have Chubbs to show me the hip technique.The controls are especially terrible in your approach game. Need 60 yards with your Pitching wedge? Sorry, the closest we can do is full blast at 120 yards, good luck estimating your power for a half swing because your backswing has nothing to do with the result. Again, no visual standard. Oh, you didn't want to hit it 85 yards over the green and into the water? Better luck next time, because that's all it is, luck.Here's some other thoughts:-Announcer is painfully annoying. You'll want to kill him.-All the players look like they could have had the same parents. -Course creator is okay, but the finished product always looks rough.-Cheaters are using "edging" techniques to never hit anything but a straight shot. Have fun with that.-You can count the number of songs featured in the game on one hand. In fact, roughly half of your hand.-No crowd. No atmosphere. -No player progression. You'll always drive 100% max at 265 yards with no wind.-No live multiplayer.-No reason you should consider buying this game.Give me Tiger Woods 2004 on the Xbox over this any day of the week. I wish I could get my money back for this. Don't buy it.I know, you're thinking, "But it's a golf game, it can't be that bad can it?" It can, and it is, because people like me saw potential and the developer did not live up to it. They still got my money. Don't let them get yours.

number of helpful: 4 of 9 people (44%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: May 31, 2016
												What an utter disappointment.I bought this game after seeing the recent positive reviews thinking that It would be as good as some of the old Tiger Woods games but in fact this game just annoys the hell out of me.First of all, when I had installed this game and attempted to start it, it kept on crashing continuously. I couldn't start the game at all. After lots of searching and experimentation, I eventually discovered that the reason the game wouldn't start is because I had SLI enabled on my graphics card. It turns out that this game hates SLI cards so much that it won't even launch when it is enabled. If I wanted to play the game, I had to play it with SLI disabled (this is a big issue for me as I have a GTX 690 which is a dual GPU card meaning that I would take a massive performance hit).The game seems unoptimised too. Using one GPU of my card (essentially a GTX 680 performance wise), the game, on its lowest settings with AA off, would rarely rise above 40FPS.The gameplay itself is fairly fun but feels a little clunkier than the old Tiger Woods games especially when it comes to the short game around the greens. Without a doubt, the best thing about the game in my opinion is the course designer. It is just so fun to create your own custom courses and the sheer number of user created courses is staggering.Probably the biggest beef with this game however, is the putting! It just infuriates me.You just don't feel that you are in control of the ball. And the worst part is that there is just no indication of how hard you are hitting the ball. You are just expected to judge power, but the putting feels very clunky so it is almost impossible to do. You always either hit the ball way too far or way too short. I just don't see why there isn't any sort of power meter.In summary:+ Great course designer+ In most cases, fun and interesting gameplay+ Tons of user created courses to play on- Clunky feel when taking shots- Putting is pretty annoyingOverall, 5/10

content:
Posted: August 22, 2014
												Really enjoying The Golf Club, especially taking on new courses every round. The physics and swing mechanics are strong (I'm a big fan of Links 2004 and am playing with an Xbox controller) and while it will take a while to feel comfortable (there are no swing meters) once you can use the advanced ball control to fine tune your distances the game becomes a lot more fun.It can look beautiful, though there are a couple of shadowing glitches I've seen, but the core golf game here I really like. Some user created courses are devilish, some creators are truly evil with the slope they put on greens, but for the most part courses are made with love and some of the official courses are very good (but I do find some are too simple). I've been playing since early access and the game has made dramatic improvements, something I hope continues post release but The Golf Club is a fantastic game for those who won't miss character progression or career modes.

content:
Posted: August 3, 2016
												Well, basically the game doesn't work. Ok, let me correct myself, kind of. It does work, but the control system doesn't.It doesn't matter if you use mouse/keyboard, a PC gamepad or an XBox controller on your PC (I've used all 3). You will always hit a number of shots at 85% power, despite doing a full power swing. The likelihood of this seems to increase with your framerate. The higher the framerate, the more likely you are to hit underpowered shots. It's as if the engine is skipping input samples the faster it goes or some such.Anyway, avoid at all costs. So much promise but ultimately let down by shoddy coding in the most important area of the game.

content:
Posted: August 24, 2014
												Pros: No loading screens between each hole. Graphics are okay but not nearly as good as Tiger Woods. Create a course is a very good idea but is not very easy to use and many of the courses I've seen created are very horsey in terms of their design and make it difficult to progress.Cons: Nearly impossible to hit 100% shot without using your mouse. Many holes you get in a situation where you need to be able to hit 100% shot and if you do not, you end up in the drink. The game is lacking content in terms of campaign modes. There is no golf shop to get better gear. The create a golfer is not robust, leaving you with a very lackluster golfer that looks very bland with no characteristics.Advice To The Developers: Please take a minute to realize that there are many holes in the games that require you to be able to hit 100% shots. I do not mind that I'm not able to hit 100% shot as I feel that adds a realesitic touch to the game but at the same time, it's very frustrating to reach a hole where you cannot progress due to the design of the course. Also consider adding more unique content such as a true campaign mode for us player who do not care to play tournaments 24/7. Perhaps even add in challenge style mini games to enhance replayability.Rating: 2.5 stars out of 5

content:
Posted: November 29, 2014
												This game had the potential to be the best golf game ever made, but failed miserably... The gameplay is flawed to say the least, nothing is quite right. The feel of the swing, the ball physics, the shot setup, and putting are just wrong. The commentary is miserable, and the graphics are poorly optimised and don't really look all that good. The menus are confusing and obviously made for consoles. The multiplayer just sucks, there are really no avatar customizations, you can't see the other players take their shots, and setup for multiplayer is abysmal. Even the couse designer leaves a lot to be desired. This game feels like it's still in Alpha, or Beta at best. Don't waste $35 on it.

content:
Posted: November 26, 2016
												I've played Links, PGA Tour, and Tiger Woods over the years.  This has to be the most boring golf game I've yet come across. I was lured in by the promise of stunning graphics, but to be honest they're more reminiscent of a playstation game of yesteryear than up to the minute Pc graphics. But the game itself has no atmosphere.  There's a guy...a very fed up sounding guy who makes dull comments about your game.  There's no crowd to cheer when you hit a great shot, and no funny quips when you hit a howler.  To be fair maybe there is a whole lot more when you get to the tournaments, but as you have to slog away to get a good enough handicap to reach the tournaments I couldn't say.  Another thing worth mentioning is the realism of the ball.  No matter how you hit it from the tee it lands and bounces exactly the same everytime.  In the very old pga tour, sometimes your ball could run for ages and slide of the fairway, or hit a hill and come to a dead stop.  Don't know what game to look at now for a decent game of golf.  I wish Links 2003 would still run on windows 10 :(

content:
Posted: April 20, 2014
Early Access Review
								Saw this launch and went "wait... sports! on PC!" and yeah..... it's back.  This isn't like tiger woods, it's like tiger woods when it was good.  I haven't played with the creator, but just based on the "feel" of the controls, swing mechanic, and letting the course design be on it's own, I'd highly recommend anyone wanting a sports game on the pc after all these years to grab it.A CONTROLLER IS A MUST FOR THIS TYPE OF GAME!  Meaning, they play best with a controller.It has very good MP integration and the two tags I just added sort of explain it all. "Classy" because of that announcer/commentary and "Needs more trees" because there just isn't enough ambiance to the courses right now.The game looks fairly decent on my PC maxed out, but I hope they add some more stuff to it down the road like better bloom and ambient occlusion, tesselation, etc.  If you have trouble getting into fullscreen hit alt+enter and it'll get there for you.  See you on the links.

								I love this! As a golfer myself, it's very appealing to the eyes even though it's early access at the moment and plays very well. The greens are slow, and putting is mostly frustrating because you know in real life you'd make that putt. This is suprisingly well done for an early access game. I don't very much like the online leaderboards seeing as I'm a solo-oriented gamer. In my head, no one's better than me at golf xP Golf is sacred in my opinion. But I'd love to see some choice as to whether or not I want to play online, which I don't.I love playing all the courses. It's great unadulterated fun and I can't wait until the game is done development-wise. I recommend this for all golfer-gamers everywhere.

number of helpful: 1 of 3 people (33%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: April 24, 2014
Early Access Review
								Very solid game thus far. A few qualms. Not being able to skip through the entire shot animation is fairly annoying. After a while, you just get bored with seeing the post-shot animation or waiting for a ball to stop rolling. Also, the putting never feels quite right. It might be that it simply takes some getting used to, but there's not really much of a guide to it. I don't know what generates speed, pulling the putter back a certain distance or how quickly I shift to the forward position on the analog stick...or both. Just really confusing. Not a lot of clarification, making putting one of the single most frustrating things about the game...much like actual golf, I suppose.Overall, though...amazing game. For an early access build, the game reeks of polish. I would like some more options with shot setup, such as foot placement, pinpointing feel (pulling the shot back to the target and utilizing the percentage listed there to make the adjustment), and slope degredation from golfer to target would allow shot setup to be more user-friendly. Hopefully, some of these options will be available at retail, but if they aren't, it's still a great golf game...and it's on PC. And that's a rare thing.

content:
Posted: April 21, 2014
Early Access Review
								The Golf ClubReal life placement of where you hit the ball! So, if you hit it in the tress or shallow water, you will then be behind them trees or in that water but still able to hit it out! I had on shank drive go on another holes fairway and got to play back towards my green from there! The game feels like real putting and real GOLF during shot previews and when you hit the ball! Nothing like tiger woods game where the game would basically show you everything, putt previews, before shot line of where it will go and much more non realistic♥♥♥♥♥♥ The Golf Club will kind of show you where the ball will land (in a given area) but that can be toggled off.Easy to use controls and gorgeous courses! And the best part is people and even you can make your own course, which is not impossible! Then share the course with the world! Then people can rate it and favorite it. Plus the way multi player is handle no is with ghost of other players round, which you can pick who you want to show, best part is this can be done all on the fly as you play your round!I'm addicted and this is so bare bones of what it will be! I can't wait for different clubs and skills points to make golfers more uniquely skilled. I could care less about making my golfer look different or changing his outfit. The career and tour modes will add more of that because I see where they have spots in the UI to show and have you accumulate points.There is probably a few other details I'm missing but I will update this as I remember more reasons why I love this game so much!

content:
Posted: January 3
												I really want to like this game.  It has the potential to be a fantastic golf simulator, but its just a total mess.  Even after being out as long as it has been.  You really roll the dice because from what I've read in other reviews the game either runs great for you or doesn't run at all.  I'm well past the point where I can return it but I wish I had.  From huge spikes and dips in frame rate, to terrain suddenly becoming exaggerated (think small hills becoming mountains) to the whole forest ending up in the sky.  It will run fine for a while, then it will just stop working arbitrarily.  Most recently I just freezes after launch.  This is on a computer that is very much capable of running this game.  Do yourself a favor and stay away.  The game play is great but it's not worth the headaches.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 1, 2015
												I recommend the game but with hesitation. The single player campaign is severely lacking as far as progression like normal games go. There is a new seasons mode but it's not done very well. You just try and advance, that's it. Where the game truly shines is the created courses. There are hundreds if not thousands of courses to choose from. Too many have high winds but that is supposed to make it challenging. I'd like a better filtering process and I heard it's coming.If you really want to get involved in the game and have some fun join the TGC Tours website (tgctours.com). They host weekly tournaments and the people there are great. You will be placed in a category with the intention of moving up the ladder to the PGA or European tours but best of luck, lots of great players out there.The game itself has a few quirks I'd like to get off my chest. First is the inconsistency at times when using a XBox 360 controller. At least once a round you will have a drive just go sideways on you even though you think you hit a good shot. The fairway bunkers and rough can also be questionable since it's almost always impossible to get a decent approach shot with a chance to get back on the green if you are any distance away. One area that takes skill is putting much like real golf. Only here you will quickly find out most putts seem to be downhill, even when you go past the pin and the return putt is also downhill. Make sense? I'd say about 75% of my putts have a downhill grade to it. I and others have also witnessed the 92% bug that comes up once in awhile. What it means is your swing is at 92%. Doesn't happen often but it does occur. The commentary can get grading at times too. I turn it off now but then it gets even more boring because you have no crowds to cheer you on.The game itself looks good, not great. It does not run very efficiently when I'm checking my CPUID monitor gauges. My guess is because it loads the whole course to make load times non existent. Good trade-ff for some, maybe not for others. The customization of the characters is a bit of a joke. The real meat of the game is the course creation so don't expect any RPG elements here or new gear. The physics and gameplay isn't bad and because I love golf I can give it some leeway since the really isn't much else to play at the moment. There is a new PGA game coming but only for the new consoles so until then this is about it for any sim like golf game.Overall I'd say about a 7/10. Not bad for a first attempt.

												Well I originally gave this title a lot of credit, 10 months ago.  It was playable, had potential and seemed like it was going somewhere good.  However, having just picked up the game again after a long hiatus **ahem Perfect Golf** I have not seen the improvements and FEATURES that are essential to a great golf game.-Optimization has been improved but the issues linger.  That's a problem!-Most importantly LOBBY.  Why in the world has this not been added?  Golf is a competitive game, and yet the ways for players to connect and compete are just not there.  That's a problem!-The swing mechanics and ball-turf interaction are still as poor as I remember, back when it was in EA.I'm sure you all have heard of Perfect Golf.  It's not the prettiest golf sim but it is far more authentic, if that is indeed what you are looking for in a golf game.Also, it's had a functioning lobby since day one EA.

number of helpful: 2 of 6 people (33%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: September 5, 2014
												Do you like to poke yourself in the eye with rusty nails?Do you love random launch trajectories?Did you accidentally vote for Mitt Romney at one point?Do you like torturing small animals?Did your parents never love you?Do you like a game that punishes you for doing things right?If you answered "yes" to any of the questions above, boy, is this the game for you!The "golf" club (I put that in quotation marks, because this game really has little to do with actual golf) is just choke full of problems that will make you want to hurt yourself.- Terrible performance, even on a middle to high end system;- Random launch trajectories, even from the tee;- Club ranges are "suggestions", they will often be off by 10 or so yards;- Swing power is dependant on framerate, which works great with the terrible perfomance;- Waiting for a 10 second arbitrary animation to finish is just delightful;Let me give you a realistic walkthrough of what will happen when you play this game:1. Fire up a random course after you've worked your way through the fairly unresponsive UI;2. Wait 10 seconds for your golfer to do some random animation, while you can't actually do anything (great);3. Notice the 15mph blasting windspeeds;4. Make an unnatrural backswing;5. Ram the controller stick forward with just the right amount of speed and power;6. See your ball fly at 89% power;7. Wonder what the hell is going on;8. Restart the course.Repeat this loop for about 8 to 10 times, untill, by the grace of the Almighty, you finally hit your tee shot with 100% power, while you didn't really do anything different.Great! Right?Nope... Same thing for every single shot in this game.You take your time figuring out how you're going to approach this green with 130 yards to go and 15mph headwind.You club up, twice maybe, yeah that's about right.You take that nice swing, everything feels great, the terrible backswing animation plays and you let 'er rip. Straight as an arrow that swing! The shot indicator in the right lower corner shows it: perfect straight line.But wait...From the git-go, your ball flies at a 5 degree angle to the left, eventhough you were on fairly even ground. Strange.What!?How did that ball go over the pin by 20 yards? Don't I have 15mph headwind?Just like yardage on your clubs. Wind is a "suggestion". It really is just quite random, except for sidewind, where 5mph will blow your ball an average of 30 yards to the side. Completely realistic!I need a ♥♥♥♥ing drink...

number of helpful: 2 of 6 people (33%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 25, 2014
												I got this on steam sale, and still feel ripped off.It truly feels like a beta release in look and feel.I can see that this will receive very little in the way of updates, as i feel a complete re-write would be required to make it playable.Pros:- It was not full price- Menu is polished BUT (see below)Cons:- Player animations are ordinary. Especially on the putting green as the players feet look like they are on ice.- Player details is poor and looks like a 2005 spec- Menu is polished BUT, its hopeless for the following reasons  - Unable to change from Imperial to Metric !!! (WTF in 2014? seriously).  - Please show me the help option  - Please show me the tutorial  - Does not naturally flow or make sense- Inability to seriously gauge the power of any shot (inc putting)- Incredibly annoying commentary (can turn down the volume, but can't reduce the amount of speech)- Very difficult to play with keyboard/mouse- "Partial controller support" should be re-worded to "Almost impossible to use without"- Where is the tutorial ? Seriously start pressing buttons and clicking around in a game to find this stuff ?- "outstanding gameplay are to be expected" ... still expecting ..... still not seeing it- No help.  Go to the forums to view help ? WHAT ?- I have played golf for 30 years, the ball when it rolls up to the second cut would bounce back a little off the higher grass... not this game- Putt the ball up to the edge of the hole and the commentator says nothing, hit the ball 10 feet past (but just skim the hole) and he gets excited and says "Thought you'd got that one" !Love golf games through the years, thought that this was worth a go.  Poor decision and recommend that you learn from my mistakes.Previous golf games beat this from at least a decade ago (and I promise you that is not an exaggerationWorld Golf Tour (the web game) is better than this, and that is free !

number of helpful: 1 of 4 people (25%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: May 2, 2014
Early Access Review
								This is the first game I've ever reviewed, and mainly because it's just that awesome.  It is by far the best golf game I've ever played and it's only early access.  It is truly a golf simulator.  You have no control over the ball in flight, such as top spin or back spin.  All of that gets set up from stance and strike options before you swing, like in real golf.  There is no turbo to super power your shot.  Right now the only customizable options are to customize clothing.  The avatar and abilities do not have customization options yet, but I believe they are on the board to be added.  No stat tracking as yet, but is also to be added.  Which is fine by me...this game is hard, so I have the chance to get used to it before stats start reminding me how much I suck.Graphics are beautiful, especially for the Unity engine.  I get FPS around 30 at the moment, but the dev team continues to release optimization updates almost every week, if not every other week.  It is multiplayer on the same computer as you can add guests and take turns with the same controller.  BTW you definately want to use a controller for this game.  I haven't tried the keyboard mouse combo, but my 360 controller is perfect for gameplay.  There is also multiplayer over the net.  You can add a friend to your round and play together.  You don't see you friends avatar yet, but you see the shot they make.  There is about a 5-10 second lag from the time they hit to when you see it.  There are still a few bugs, like when my brother loses a ball in water, it sometimes gets stuck and I can't see him play anymore even though he's still hitting through the course.  There are no load times between holes whatsoever.  The entire course is pre-loaded, so in your map view you can see your buddy hit even if he's on a different hole.There is an unlimited amount of golf courses to play through a course creator which is extremely easy to use.  You can have complete control and pour hours and hours into creating your dream course or re-creating your favorite course in real life.  Or you can set up basic options and let the computer generate one on it's own.  You can make a course extremely easy with slow greens, wide open fairways, and no wind, to being a lose-10-balls-every-time-you-play course.It is fully worth the price, in fact I almost always wait for a game to go on sale.  I didn't with this one.  I took a chance and it is definately worth it.  And with all the coming additions to the game, it is going to get even better.If you are a fan of golf, real or digital, this is a must-have golf game.  Better than any Tiger Woods game I ever played.  You won't be disappointed.

number of helpful: 1 of 4 people (25%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: April 19, 2014
Early Access Review
								I recommend this game with a few caveats. Make sure to get a controller. You can get a 360 controller for $30 and had best buy price match it. Plugs right into the PC, no setup required. Graphics are fairly nice, frame rate is pretty bad, course editor is great, and it's much more of a sim than a casual golf game. And for now you can only play a single round.Does anyone know how to get in touch with the developers? The putting system needs help badly. You can't look at the contour of your whole putt and you pretty much have to guess how hard to hit it. All you know is your putter hits it 105 feet at full swing. The rest is a guessing game. Same with iron and wedge shots. There is no marker/meter/percentage...anything to indicate where your swing should stop/how far to hit it. So you basically have to hit it 100% or risk hitting it 40%. This part REALLY needs work and I hope they fix it because if not, the final product will be an unenjoyable expereience. Also, when you preview your shot there is no reticle whatsoever, so you have no idea if you're going to hit it into or over a fairway bunker, water, etc. It's pretty bad.I'm recommending it because of the core game that is in place. But if the developers don't make serious gameplay improvements, it could ultimately end up being a pretty bad game.

content:

												Hello Everyone,On first view, I am enthralled by a game that is going to stretch the golf world. The ability to create your own courses, Amazing! However, To fully explore this, you need to be able to connect to the online servers that house them. I have yet in the months of owning this been able to connect to the servers. They automatically do not connect and I have no option but to play with the single player abilities. This is not terrible, considering that even what is offered in the single player world. I would say that is my biggest let down. The other is the swing mechanics. I find that it is difficult to manipulate and is at best on the line of a phone/tablet application. Where those options can be very annoying and frustrating. If I were to be grading this game, I will give it a 5 out of 10. There are great ideas that are placed in the building of the game. There is a a lot of potential on where this can go. With the DLC, this does enable someone with my inability to access the online part a chance of competitive golf.  The drawback is all the technical issues, bugs and/or glitches. Since I also have not been able to experience the online portion, I have lost interest in what is the base game.  The simulation is not pure and if they are trying to advertise as a golf simulator, then they may want to check again as a possible arcade game. I would recommend this game, if the support can figure out the issues. I am not saying do not buy, but rather just be wary that this game has a record of issues to be worked out. Sincerely,TriiNitY

content:
Posted: July 2, 2014
Early Access Review
								The game definitely has its perks, but I cannot honestly recommend to the average golf gamer. Being a PC gamer, I hadn't played a golf game since TW08 so I was excited for this game coming out on PC. I played it quite a bit at first, but have ultimately become bored with it and can't see myself playing much more (FWIW my actual time spent on this game is probably closer to ~40 hours than what is displayed on my profile). I'll start off with the good:1. The course creator. The course creator is loads of fun, relatively easy to jump into, and is capable of creating many different layouts. Camera controls, and the terrain tools (mostly the hill brushes) I found annoying at times, but nothing game breaking. 2. The game looks extremely good visually. Furthermore, using the lighting options in the course creator, you can create some absolutely spectacular views on your course.3. Putting. Putting is very rewardable in this game making you actually work for many short putts, and making distance control a challenge for long range putts.As for the bad:1. While the game looks good visually with high end settings, don't expect to actually be able to play with good graphics unless you have a good gaming computer. My high end non-gaming laptop, which does meet the system requirements, can only run the game smoothly on a 800x600 resolution with low graphical detail. Quite frankly, the game looks ten years old with these settings. From discussions on here and the HB website, the graphics card seems to be the problem. I have a GeForce 630M, so if your graphics card is comparable to that don't expect to be able to play with reasonable looking graphics.2. Single player lacks any sort of depth. Given that all you can do is play a round of golf, unless creating courses is your thing, don't expect much replayability. Don't know about multiplayer because I don't care about it.3. My biggest problem with this game is simply that it isn't close to a realistic golf sim. I easily hit over 90% of fairways, never unintentionally hook or slice the ball, hit probably around 80% of greens in regulation, hit clear over the green from the green side bunker half the time, hit a 75% shot anywhere from 30-100%, and despite putting being pretty good, I still hit a 5ft putt 20ft past the hole on occasion. This kills the game for me. I think a lot these problems come from lacking difficulty sliders, which in my view are essential for any good sports sim game. If you're expecting realistic results from this game, there is a good chance you will be severely disappointed.4. Mouse/keyboard controls are a nightmare. I gave up with the mouse/keyboard after a couple of hours, and borrowed my friends xbox360 controller instead. Would strongly recommend using an analog controller.I would recommend purchasing this game if course creation is really your thing, but if you are looking for an in depth realistic golf sim, I can't recommend The Golf Club.

number of helpful: 2 of 7 people (29%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 9, 2015
												[Update 21/10/2015]I upgraded my graphics card to an nVidia GTX 960 and the game now runs at an acceptable level of smoothness (in full screen).  However for any other potential buyers, be aware that The Golf Club runs very poorly on my ATI HD5770 1GB card (5 years old).  The HD5770  continued to work very well (with sensible settings) in every game I tried, except for The Golf Club (see below).   I upgraded simply because I needeed a card that supports GPU rendering in Blender.  At least I have not completely wasted my money now on this game.[End Update]This game has a number of problems: Inexplicably it's only playable on my HD5700, 8GB, AMD 3.3Ghz dual core desktop PC in windowed mode.  In fullscreen mode constant stuttering destroys any ability to time shots properly.  Reducing all graphics settings made no difference, only windowed  mode reduced the stuttering to playable levels.  Even then, the game feels sluggish, trees pop into view during the tracking camera views and even sound effects seem to cause stutters.I have found it almost impossible to reliably play a shots with say 75% or 80% power.  There is no visual indicator of your shot power, you just have to watch the backswing and start the fore swing when you feel the time is right.  As a result I have to just check the current distance to hole / wind and then pick the club with a 100% power distance that matches the required distance.  This makes lobs and green approach shots extremely difficult frustrating.  (It's essential to play with a controller with analog sticks, I have a logitech dual action).The course designer has very poor usability.  I've tried to landscape a links course from scratch (no holes, trees) by sculpting terrain.  The raise terrain tool is the most ridiculous tool I've seen in any design program.  You change the raise/lower height by holding shift and scrolling the mouse wheel.  However the larger the brush the larger the height change. For example if I have a very large brush (for large scale terrain editing), the height jumps to 0 to 800 feet! The only way to get smaller height change is to shrink the brush to the smallest size, then adjust the height in small increments, then increase the brush size again and apply the change.  To top it all off, once you apply the brush, the height settings are lost and you have to go through the same stupid process.  Imaging doing this to sculpt an entire map.The tree shadows, even at high quality are quite blocky and unrealistic.  More importantly when there are shadows on the green it makes seeing the hole and judging the borrow very dififcult.  Maybe this is how it is on a real course but in real life there is no grid overlaying the green that is obscured by shadows. The developer provides no manual or useful playing guide.  There are video tutorials that explain some of the basics but but they are brief / out of date.I wanted to like this game as there are so few new golf games these days.  However this is a released game, not early access and as such it is simply not good enough in it's current state.  There were more enjoyable golf games available 12 years ago.If at least the performance issues and the swing power issue were fixed I'd certainly like the game a lot more and would likely revise this review.

content:
Posted: March 16, 2015
												If you like golf and want a simulation experience then this game may be worth your money but if you want a golf game for fun this is not the game for you!This game has been out for a while now and the updates are becoming less and less frequent (maybe they're concentrating on the console versions?), there still isn't a career mode so all you are doing is playing the courses either on your own or against ghosts of other people.  There's also very little atmosphere when you're playing your round of golf, there's no crowd for example and the commentary most likely will get on your nerves pretty quick.  As far as the game play goes then it's ok but unless you have a xbox controller I wouldn't recommend  playing this on your keyboard/mouse combo.  All the shots are there, pitch, chip, loft shot but they are very awkward to pull off if  you need to do a half swing or 3/4 swing motion.  I'm not saying you can't do it, it's just very hit and miss ie. you're more then likely to either duff the ball 5 yards forward or overhit your mark by 20yards when attempting these shots so you are left with trying to judge your yardage so you can get a full swing from a club.  Putting takes a long time to master and even get used to, your first few tries will either go miles past the cup or end up miles short of the cup.  There's no easy way to judge how much power you are putting with hence why it takes a long time to master.Until they add more content like the career mode then I would hold on.  I've not played the game in 4-5months since buying it as have gotten bored with it.Hope this helps for people stuck on the edge.Edit on 14/04/2015:  Would seem they are now charging dlc for adding a career mode, very disappointed by this news as was expecting it in a future update for free considering I forked out ~£30 for it back in early access.  Will not be making another early access purchase again as I feel the money I put in has been put towards the console versions of the game and for the devs to add extra content that they will charge for.

												Completely unplayable.  It might be nice to have some in-game instruction as to how to swing, how to aim, how to putt, all that stuff.  Apparently I'm supposed to have that information pre-installed in my brain -- if it's in there, it's cunningly hidden.Once one does a web search to see how you actually take a swing, it might be nice to have the swing mechanism actually *work*.  Pull the mouse back, move the mouse forward.  Sounds simple enough.  Pull the mouse back, well, okay, that's sort of a backswing.  Move the mouse forward, and... nothing.  Not even a twitch.To make matters worse, I'm running on a brand new system and the graphics are jerky and slow even after stepping down resolution, antialiasing, and all the other graphics options.  What in the world am I supposed to have to run this game smoothly, a server farm?The programmers should be ashamed of themselves. This is very distracting and cannot be fixed with out a restart.4) Production still feel incomplete.  Commentary for examples sounds like a placeholder that never got replaced.

number of helpful: 3 of 10 people (30%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 24, 2014
												Best Golfing game ever.....Since my review of over 2 years ago, the improvements to this game have been many. Along with the fixing of map and image glitches, the addition of the handicap system for match-making makes your online experience much fairer. The official courses range from easy (which can be fun to post pro scores!) to very difficult courses where wind, ground slope, green elevation, pace of greens and contours of greens make club selection of the utmost importance. The type of shot selected i.e. flop, chip etc. also becomes important when needing to keep your ball below the wind or to deal with  fast paced greens. I have been playing golf simulation games for over 30 years and still believe this to be the best golfing game ever! (Tiger Woods was arcady.... this is as close to a round of golf that i've found)An understanding of Golf IRL is beneficial, however learning the mechanics of this game can be enjoyable on its own.Well done to the Devs for creating and improving this game.

number of helpful: 3 of 10 people (30%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 15, 2016
												I bought this game hoping to relive a misspent youth playing "David Leadbetter's Greens" and "Links" back in the '90s and to enjoy a virtual round or two with my son.I really wanted to enjoy this, but using a mouse it is utterly impossible to hit the ball repeatably.  The game uses a non-intuitive, undocumented system which I have not been able to unravel.  Help isn't.  Tutorial is non existant.  I have sat for half an hour randomly clicking, moving the mouse and releasing without any consistent results.  All I have to show for this investment of my time is one stroke, yes, I hit the ball successfully ONCE in half an hour.  Otherwise it's click, move down, move up, release, nothing, repeat.Back in the day there was a simple, intuitive stroke-wheel interface that worked beautifully.  Click and hold for power, release and click as close to the bottom of the swing as possible to avoid hooks & slices.  Seriously guys, implement that as an option and I'm not asking for a refund.  Let me know if you do & I'll be back.

												Well... the game started out wonderfully with features regularly being added. Unfortunately devs have taken a sledge hammer approach to the swing mechanics. You'll find most use a controller for this game - if you want to do that then you'll likely fare far better than struggling along with a mouse & keyboard format that's been forgotten by the design team. Developers offer little to no feedback towards any changes - stealth updates with no notes and stealth mechanic changes that aren't mentioned in major patches. Forum moderators can offer no information on developer progress towards updates which take weeks even on PC. Feedback feels largely ignored for the PC crowd, rather routine "dev" blogs focus on xbox and PS4 issues almost entirely. Genuinely sad writing this as I've plut hundreds of hours into it - it used to be great, wonderful, a really enjoyable test of skil. Sad times.

number of helpful: 1 of 6 people (17%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: September 21, 2015
												A one word description for this game is "CLUNKY."  The game physics are really REALLY BAD.  Without a special type controller (like a Wii controller) the swing meter is very hard to use especially with a mouse.  The ball physics aren't true and a single tee box system for all skill levels is very poor in design.  In real golf one doesn't expect a high handicapper or some who can't hit for distance to play from the Championship Tees but the way this game is setup all the holes designed for the stock courses are like playing from these tees.  A four tee system would be an improvement.  Trying to use the system settings box at the start of the game requires a degree in computer science to figure out and even then when do try to adjust a setting the game engine gets worse.  This game still has a LONG LONG WAY to go before its ready for prime time especioally for DX11.  This games competitor is further along than this and is still "early development."This game grades at: F

number of helpful: 1 of 6 people (17%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 1, 2014
Early Access Review
								Preliminary feelings as of June 2014:This game seems to try very hard to overheat my video card.  I've run Titanfall, Arkham Origins, and Battlefield on very high settings without any issue, but this game slowly degrades and starts glitching out and artifacting all over the place.  The temps are higher than those other games.  I'm running a Radeon r9 270.The swing/put mechanism is nice I guess, but it is certainly not inherently better than the more classic interfaces from older games.  One could argue that this introduces a realistic element of "skill" and "practice" but that would be neglecting to mention that not everyone has the same controller setup, nor do people have the same hands, nor do people have the same amount of time to practice.  This is a video game that people paid for so there really isn't a need to create a gap to simulate the fact that some people are just going to be bad at golf without massive amounts of practice.  At the very least, add in a more classical control scheme option for more casual players so that people who want a fun PC golf game can have it while the more hardcore golf fans can have their some what more sim styled game at the same time.The courses are plentiful and you can edit and create new ones so there really is no point in rating those.  The course system they have is excellent, however and exactly what a golf game needs.  Kudos to that.  Another kudos is the way you play against ghost rivals.  Minor annoyance:  Cannot name guest players in hot seat multiplayer.  Jeopardy on the NES lets me name each player.  No excuses.Unfortunately I cannot recommend the game for the current price at this moment.  I'll fiddle with the game a bit more to see if I can improve the performance, and hopefully future patches improve everything in general.  This has the makings of the best golf game on for PCs, and one of the best ever, but it definitely has a ways to go.

content:
Posted: September 23, 2015
												Less than 40 rounds played and I already have an ace from over 200 yards out, eagles from 100yds out, and atleast a dozen other shots into the cup from off the green from various distances.This game is clearly tailored to shooting unrealistically low scores. The swings are dumbed down enough to teach a 3yr old to hit straight, and all the information you need, and precise loft control with grids and percentages is given to make a shot of any distance nearly effortless. This is dial-a-shot-golf, void of any risk/reward you may be looking for in a golf game. Putting, however, does require a special touch, but on an average course you have to mess up pretty bad or not be paying attention to be left with putts of any significant distance. It is not a stretch by any means to say this game would have been dead in the water if it weren't for countless community made courses because the gameplay is dull and unrewarding.Simply put, if you are here because you love golf and are looking for an authentic experience, I would turn away and look elsewhere.

												1) The swing motion is exponential realtive to your mouse instead of 1:1 (meaning your in game swing starts much slower and weaker than the mouse movement would imply but eventually gets up to speed. (long delays in motions that are supposed to be ~1-2 seconds) 2) The character is still doing pre-swing motions after I click and drag back to start my swing, meaning the mouse and swing have completely disconnected from each other.3) I played 36 holes before uninstalling, I turned the commentary off after 2.After reading thru a lot of forum posts to see if the complete lack of feel during the short game is just me or not, it seems to be affecting a lot of people using a mouse instead of a console controller. Sounds like a good game if you plug in a controller, I strongly recommend staying away from this game if you plan on using a mouse.

number of helpful: 5 of 15 people (33%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: January 30, 2016
												If the developer chooses to not include the "3 click swing" as an option despite fan feedback, then they obviously don't care much about what their fans want and their sales will reflect that. It doesn't make sense to not include at least some form of guage during swings, in this game you go in completely blind because the developer wants a more "realistic" experience. Well guess what, this isn't real life, it's a video game being used with a game pad or a mouse. In real life, I have the benefit of the tactile experience with the club, I have the benefit of knowing my own strength, I have the benefit of being able to modulate my swing based on my own body. In this game, I have no idea how hard a hit is going to be simple based on how far back the pixelated avatar's arms are back. There's no good guage or meter system. If they aren't going to include the 3-click swing, they should at least show how far each club would hit at full power, and then show the power meter filling up as you pull back the swing. Anyway, it's their decision to develop the game how they want to develop it, but they deserve their mixed reviews and I definitely recommend not buying this title. There's other problems too, but this is a quick and easy example of the developer's refusal to work with the medium and the control schemes in an intelligent way.

												TERRIBLE GAME. DO NOT BUY!!! This is the least fun golf game I've ever played. I wouldn't recommend it even if it were free. There were honesty better golf games on the sega genesis. DO NOT BUY THIS GAME. IT STINKS. I won't buy another title from this developer. I disliked this game so much that I actually went through the trouble to contact them. I don't care if you remember if you got my contact or not. Too bad I played it for more than 2 hours so I can't get a refund. It was winter time and I couldn't play real golf, otherwise I would not have spent the time I did. Furthermore, this game is almost at the "negative overall" review threshold. He's basically begging people to change their negative reviews, but being pretty immature about it. If you are thinking about dropping $30 on this game, then I urge you to just take a look at the defensive and insulting way that the developer responds to people who honestly thinks the game is BAD. In my opinion, the lack of integrity and the way that the developer basically says it's the reviewers fault makes me throw up in my mouth a little.About the game...........The putting is bad. The physics are bad/unrealistic. It's easier to get good at real golf than it is to play this golf "sim". The graphics are "maybe" sega dreamcast level. In game, it doesn't look as good as the screenshots. It's just not a fun game and a complete rip-off at $30. I really hope the developer stops responding to negative reviews the way he is because it's really offensive. He should probably take it to heart and come to terms with the fact that the game isn't good and stop insulting people who think that The Golf Club delivers poorly as a golf simulation.I also don't care what awards you've won. All that tells me is that I should no longer trust those sources when determining whether or not to buy a game.

content:
Posted: February 8, 2015
												First of all, the Steam Store multi-player tag and the dev description border on false advertising ("The game supports live multi-player for up to four people locally or online, with the option to play either turn-based or simultaneously"). The multiplayer mode implemented in this is not exactly what you would expect.Unfortunately I acquired this via gift swapping, else I'd consider raising hell to get my money back.You need to manually add up to three friends as "live rivals" and then enable "turn order" to get a reasonable MP experience (albeit with quite some shot transfer delay). Why they don't go for some lobby/party system and actual realtime MP is beyond me.The jolliest feature I found was that F12, the Steam screenshot button, is by default bound to... ♥♥♥♥ing up the game.Gamepad and keyboard controls are wildly different (unbalanced) beasts, and neither makes it easy to hit a controlled shot at less than 100% power. TGC can't really decide what it wants to be, with developers decrying dial-a-number golf games, but then offering much of the same in their loft/draw/fade "shot modification" menu and overly reliable 100% shots.Overall, I very much regret the acquisition. In the light of the price and the overall prevalence of negative reviews (with some additional complaints not mentioned here -- for example I did not experience forum censorship first-hand, having not ventured into this game's forum), I can't recommend it for anybody but hardcore (PC-)golf fans.P.S.: Interested parties can also observe cameos of some excellent Unity-style physics systems, like the ball being literally unable to stop rolling on various surfaces. Watch this happen on entirely flat tarmac, serve with Yakety Sax & a fine fruit juice.

content:
Posted: July 6, 2015
												I love golf games, and I will probably continue to play this one from time to time, but I don't recommend it, and I wouldn't buy it again. The pros are that the game runs super smoothly, the courses are beautiful and the ability to easily create your own courses (although I've never made one myself - I have played a few created ones, and they were well done). However, the game is extremely inconsistent when it comes to gameplay. Most of the time, you need a club or less than the recommended club for a particular length. 170 yards on flat ground, no elevation change and no wind? Choose a club that hits 158 yards, or even a club lower. Use the club that's supposed to hit 170, and you'll be lucky if the ball doesn't go 190 yards.  Putting is also very inconsistent from hole to hole on the same course. Chipping is a freaking nightmare. If you have to hit a ball anywhere from 10-20 yards off the green, it's a literal crap shoot. What might send a ball 3 yards this time, might send it all the way across a flat green the next time. The wind is also a nightmare. A side wind of 10mph might send a perfectly hit shot 30 yards off course one hole, and the same wind won't effect the next tee shot at all. Another big con is that everyone plays with the exact same clubs; there is no variation, no upgrades, no individual style. Unfortunatley, there isn't much else to choose from in the world of golf games, and so I will continue to be frustrated playing this one for now.

number of helpful: 1 of 8 people (13%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 26, 2015
												Well i sat there during the summer sales pondering should i get this game , should i not . So i took the plunge and thought quite steep price for what you get but on the whole its not a bad game at all just lacking SO  much in gameplay options.The game itself and mechanics are well done , its quaint and peaceful like a real game of golf should be , on the downside though even in tournament or seasons mode its like that and i think a smattering of spectators would help make it feel alot more important and not just another round , so that to me is a reasonable sized negative.Graphics  , meh suppose to be  great but i found them very very underwhelming , your player is like a robot and does nothing NOTHING to bar the odd raise of a hand to celebrate a good score , i got a eagle and he just stood there like c3-po ,um bad.Courses quite underwhelming and boring and barely any courses to play that are official.(official courses lower your handicap)Handicap system is the 1 plus , a nice little feauture where you play 4 rounds on a official course to get a handicap and every time you play one of the official courses(marked with a tick next to hcp) , then it helps re-calculate your handicap , which is used on solo play and tournaments .A feauture i do like and is a plus.The course creator is a fab idea and is reasonably new in golf games . And everyone is pretty raving about it but its soooo long winded and soooo boring and sooooo HARD to control and do anything, even youtube videos its 45 mins a hole to put a  wider fairway a bit of extra rough and a few bunkers, clunky , unresponsive and damn right poor .Not good tut tutIt is frustrating as hell , i can really see what the developers where trying to do with the mouse or controller swing making you get the feel for the stroke and hitting the ball and yes takes practice and time, i recently got alot better at driving and iron play with my straightness , but boy oh boy have they totally messed up with the putting.TOTAL  shambles. You use mouse/controller to hit the putt and no i dont want it as easy as the old tiger woods games where but jesus its impossible.You can hit a cracking putt from 15 foot on hole 1 , hole 2 with same length and speed of green and hills taking into account you hit excatly the same amount and it literally goes 2 foot. Putting for me ruins the entire game and yes i admit 50 percent of that is because im terrible at it , but the whole way of putting is dreadful it doesnt work and is not at all responsive.Fell the shot???Developers  sorry i cant feel nothing on the greens , give us players some sort of option just on the green for a alterantive 3 click or 2 click system still leaving us to work out the power distance and slopes. Also the telling you wehter its up hill or downhill is screwed apparently every single putt in 20 rounds has been DOWNHILL , literally every putt .BROKEN AND FIX IT . In conclusion would i recomend .....NO not for the current price and the awful graphics and lack of gameplay options and especially the gamebreaker THE PUTTINGAVOID until a major major overhaulUPDATEnow july 2015 and a few major updates have been applied to this game, its worse im afraid , putting is even more unrealistic , the course designer now does not even barely work at all and freezes (no my graphics card is way more than enough) , the game freezes sorry to say but avoid even more , ive given it a fair crack of the whip but no no no

								At this time, unless they improve the keyboard and mouse controls for the game, I have to advise everybody that is going to want to play with keyboard and mouse to steer a wide berth around this dud.Also make sure that you have a computer similar to those used to launch the space shuttles at Nasa as it's a major lag monster. content:
Posted: June 26, 2014
Early Access Review
								Huge mistake.  From playing I could immediately tell this was awful.  Using the mouse is like emulating an analog stick.  This is a straight console game, not even a port.  It's like a badly emulated console game.  Absolutely impossible to get any feel.  When you start to pull down on the mouse for backswing, your player has a delayed reaction, same with the downswing.  If you want to hit a 50% shot, good effing luck.  Putting is basically impossible since there's no feel and so much lag between what you do with your mouse and your characters animations on the screen.  I immediately regretted my decision to buy this.  Should have just dug up my copy of Tiger Woods Golf 2008 or whatever year it was before EA messed it up.  Strong do not buy unless you like supporting console ports that are worse than your average Ubisoft port.  Honestly, on second thought, I'd rather play a game that has Uplay than play this piece of crap again.

number of helpful: 2 of 16 people (13%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: January 28
												So far -- SO BAD!!!!! 28Jan17:The system requirements as stated on Steam are WRONG -- States that the game requires a DirectX 11 compatible graphics card.  Not True.  And because of this I can't even get past the initial splash screen.  Instead I get : "Fatal Error -- Direct3D shader not available" and the game closes.The game requires Direct3d FEATURE LEVEL 11_0 which is apparently ONLY available on graphics cards which support DirectX 12 -- which only makes sense in Microsoft-world !  My DirectX 11 graphics card only supports Feature Level 10_0 and lower  -- as, apparently, do ALL DirectX 11 graphics cards.This is both misleading and a bad development choice since this leaves a huge population out there that will THINK they have capable hardware but will buy the program and run into the same nonsense, which will result in reviews like this one.I am very disappointed so I tried to contact HB-Studios support.  Good luck with that one!After drilling down through all of the Steam support menus, I landed at HB-Studios support Forum and had to fill out the required registration only to be told 'Admin approval required -- please wait 24 hours for approval'36 hours later -- still no approval.Once I hear from them I will give them a chance to get the game working because this is the package I Really Want.  But if they can't - MONEY BACK please.I'll update this review upon hearing from HBS.29JAN17:I can see why there might be confusion -- here is a link to Wikipedia article describing Feature Levels in the Direct3D API specifications:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Feature_levels_in_Direct3DBTW - now 60 hours later and no response from HBS support -- maybe Monday.30JAN17:Still no email from the HB-Studios 'Admin' regarding my support/forum login for their site.  So much for 24 hours (Now at 3 DAYS & 7 hours).  Hope springs eternal.1FEB17:Response to my post from HBS -- appears to be some problem with HBS site foruim signup.1FEB17:After an appologetic, polite, and very rapid-fire email response, we find that, apparently an Nvidia GTS 250 Video card and a 3+ Ghz 6-core processor and 8 Gb of ram, aren't up to the standards of this game -- hard core gamers running windows 8+ with new hardware ONLY allowed.  Can't afford to throw hundreds of dollars at this issue when so many great games (Minecraft, Banished, etc.) DO run on this meager system.  Once again I have to reiterate, that I believe this is a bad marketing decision, since I'll bet there are a lot more of us old-timers with lower spec systems than there are hard-core gamers who would LOVE to be able to play this game.I'll have to have my money back so I can buy Jack Nicklaus Perfect Golf instead -- It only requires DirectX 9 and windows 7 +. A pity -- I'd really prefer 'The Golf Club'. But ANYTHING is better than being a continuous revenue stream for Winning Putt.

												Has potential and will keep trying it now and again but it is unplayable as a PC golf game.  It has the absolutely worst mouse swing mechanics ever.  It is not responsive and spongy.  There is such a delay that you don;t know if it started to register your swing or not.  Putting is a joke as there is no feel for the putt and that mouse swing mechanic means that you will have no idea if your swing is registered until it's too late.It looks nice, though it seems to require a NASA computer if you want any bumped up graphics at all.I'll keep playing it though, but it seems I get halfway through a round and give up because of the lousy swing mechanics (guess I am just wishing this would bring back that Links feel).(edit 4/18/15) - They have improved the puting as it now responds much better than the move the mouse and hope for the best approach initially.  Though I am having major issues with power for the other shots, seems like no matter how lighly I have moved the mouse forward when I don't want full power the shot still ends up being 90% or higher.  I can now tell the difference in force used for putting but it seems other shots don't have the same level of sensitivity.  I really suck at the game, which is okay, but I still don't feel comfortable recommending it yet.The other issue that is more than a minor issue is that several times I have pulled back to start the shot, the player starts his backswing, I then complete my shot pushing forward and the player never shoots, he just re-addresses the ball.  Have had that happen multiple times and it is rather annoying as by about the 4th time you try swinging you really are just frustrated that the other swings didn't take and are bound to have a bad shot.(edit 8/16/15) - I have given up trying to use the mouse swing.  I have started to play using the controller and for a controller based game it is pretty decent.  I wish the mouse swing could be improved, that still has no feel at all, like guessing on every shot.  Still not sure if I can recommend it as a PC golf game, it's more like a console port.(edit:  8/18/15) - Starting to like the game now that I have given myself up to using a controller.  It is really growing on me.  This may become a recommend soon.  Wish there was a neutral option.(edit: 10/25/15) - I have changed this to a thumbs up.  While I seriously wish the mouse swing worked better, using the x-box 360 controller works quite well.  I still suck at the game itself but have found it enjoyable.  Using the controller I feel a better level of control of my swing and the graphics are good (though I have my settings turned down as it requires more power than I have to crank them up.  I recommend this only if you don't mind using a controller.  If you want to use a mouse swing, I would avoid the frustration.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: November 25, 2014
												6/21/2015 REVISION - Okay, so I have played this game a little more, and since my review below, they have released the collector's edition expansion, which added some new design features and a "Seasons" mode, which, as one would guess, is a type of career mode. This addition has brought some more value to the game than it had before, and as a result, I am reversing my original "No" recommendation to a "Yes."This game certainly has its quirks, but I am beginning to like it more and more. It still has not lived up to the hype, but I have changed my feeling on recommending this game to others. If you are willing to drop the money for the complete collectors edition, you will likely not be disappointed with this game. Make sure you have a machine that can handle the graphics decently, though, as these courses come out beautifully and you want to experience them as such.~~~~Original Review (November 2014):This game is not bad, but definitely didn't live up to the hype. The lack of a career mode with depth features is a let-down, and the limited amount of character customization is one even more so. Also, it would have been cool to have some sort of earnings system or something of the like that integrates with a career mode to give it long-term replay value. Also, the lack of online multiplayer features is a bit frustrating.Mechanics - keyboard and mouse gameplay is really, really not enjoyable once you have tried it with a controller. You will notice a ridiculous difference in your accuracy when using a controller joystick over a mouse for swinging. All that being said, the course designer is cumbersome, and almost feels like the main attraction of the game. If you want to design a virtual golf course and have the time and imagination to devote to it, this game is for you. The course designer has a lot of options and - I would imagine - is unmatched in its genre in the scope of this feature. Also, the gameplay is not bad at all, but can be quirky. The commentary is really just downright annoying and repetitive after a while. Overall, if you are not big into golf games, avoid it. It's really unbalanced and does not have enough of the career and online features to attract a wide scope of gamers. If you are interested in designing elaborate and realistic looking golf courses and playing them for fun, it could be worth the 35 bucks, but I would honestly wait until there's a drop in price or a sale to consider it even if that is your MO.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: October 4, 2016
												Too much to not like for me.With either a mouse or an Xbox controller, it's hard to specify a less-than-100% shot. The putting and chipping power seems to be based on a different scale than fairway play. So, you have to hit the ball significantly harder on the green than off it.The swinging is all analog; there is no three-click power meter. Just as "Cue Club 2" uses a power meter while "Virtual Pool 4" is all analog, The Golf Club attempts to recreate the more organic "feel" of physically moving a thing (mouse or thumbstick) to replicate swinging a club (like the pool cue in Virtual Pool 4.) How well it executes this is up to your taste. I think the power detection is too inconsistent.There are no other people anywhere at all. No computer opponents or spectators at all. Not even when playing a season are there any crowds or applause or anything.There is a disembodied voice that I turned off after playing a few rounds. He continually states the obvious and offers no actual advice and just becomes annoying.I find the Tiger Woods series on Xbox 360 or maybe even the old Microsoft Links 2003 to be superior golf games..

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: March 21, 2015
												So after about a year and a half since the last review, I am here to turn that frown upside down. The putting is much much better now. It is a much more enjoyable experience. My only complaint now is that there is no progression, and it drives me silly bonkers that on a perfect swing you can still barely hit it 275 yards. Overall, though, a thumbs up from a previous thumbs down.Original Review (4/2015)I want to like this game. I really do. Overall it is decent. Good graphics. Good modding community. However, what ruins the game completely is the short game and putting. It is almost impossible to get it right, and it is completely inconsistent. If they would fix that, this would be a good game, but I refuse to give it a good rating until they do.
